BitField.name: FRAME
BitField.description: Frame interrupt routing

Enum.name: LP
Enum.description: FRAME interrupt is routed to USB_INT_REQ_LP.

Enum.name: HP
Enum.description: FRAME interrupt is routed to USB_INT_REQ_HP.

BitField.name: EPEN0
BitField.description: 0= The corresponding bit in USBDMARSt is set when an interrupt occurs for this endpoint. 1 = The corresponding bit in USBEpIntSt is set when an interrupt occurs for this endpoint. Implies Slave mode for this endpoint.

BitField.description: 0= The corresponding bit in USBDMARSt is set when an interrupt occurs for this endpoint. 1 = The corresponding bit in USBEpIntSt is set when an interrupt occurs for this endpoint. Implies Slave mode for this endpoint.

BitField.name: PHY_EP
BitField.description: Physical endpoint number (0-31)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: MPS
BitField.description: The maximum packet size value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RX_DATA
BitField.description: Data received.

BitField.name: PKT_LNGTH
BitField.description: The remaining number of bytes to be read from the currently selected endpoint's buffer. When this field decrements to 0, the RxENDPKT bit will be set in USBDevIntSt.

BitField.name: DV
BitField.description: Data valid. This bit is useful for isochronous endpoints. Non-isochronous endpoints do not raise an interrupt when an erroneous data packet is received. But invalid data packet can be produced with a bus reset. For isochronous endpoints, data transfer will happen even if an erroneous packet is received. In this case DV bit will not be set for the packet.

BitField.name: PKT_RDY
BitField.description: The PKT_LNGTH field is valid and the packet is ready for reading.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_DATA
BitField.description: Transmit Data.

BitField.name: PKT_LNGTH
BitField.description: The remaining number of bytes to be written to the selected endpoint buffer. This field is decremented by 4 by hardware after each write to USBTxData. When this field decrements to 0, the TxENDPKT bit will be set in USBDevIntSt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RD_EN
BitField.description: Read mode control. Enables reading data from the OUT endpoint buffer for the endpoint specified in the LOG_ENDPOINT field using the USBRxData register. This bit is cleared by hardware when the last word of the current packet is read from USBRxData.

BitField.name: WR_EN
BitField.description: Write mode control. Enables writing data to the IN endpoint buffer for the endpoint specified in the LOG_ENDPOINT field using the USBTxData register. This bit is cleared by hardware when the number of bytes in USBTxLen have been sent.

BitField.name: LOG_ENDPOINT
BitField.description: Logical Endpoint number.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CMD_PHASE
BitField.description: The command phase:

BitField.name: CMD_CODE_WDATA
BitField.description: This is a multi-purpose field. When CMD_PHASE is Command or Read, this field contains the code for the command (CMD_CODE). When CMD_PHASE is Write, this field contains the command write data (CMD_WDATA).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CMD_RDATA
BitField.description: Command Read Data.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RX_DATA
BitField.description: Receive data.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TXDATA
BitField.description: Transmit data.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: When 1, issue a START condition before transmitting this byte.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: When 1, issue a STOP condition after transmitting this byte.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TDI
BitField.description: Transaction Done Interrupt. This flag is set if a transaction completes successfully. It is cleared by writing a one to bit 0 of the status register. It is unaffected by slave transactions.

BitField.name: AFI
BitField.description: Arbitration Failure Interrupt. When transmitting, if the SDA is low when SDAOUT is high, then this I2C has lost the arbitration to another device on the bus. The Arbitration Failure bit is set when this happens. It is cleared by writing a one to bit 1 of the status register.

Enum.name: NO_ARBITRATION_FAILU
Enum.description: No arbitration failure on last transmission.

Enum.name: ARBITRATION_FAILURE_
Enum.description: Arbitration failure occurred on last transmission.

BitField.name: NAI
BitField.description: No Acknowledge Interrupt. After every byte of data is sent, the transmitter expects an acknowledge from the receiver. This bit is set if the acknowledge is not received. It is cleared when a byte is written to the master TX FIFO.

Enum.name: LAST_TRANSMISSION_DI
Enum.description: Last transmission did not receive an acknowledge.

BitField.name: DRMI
BitField.description: Master Data Request Interrupt. Once a transmission is started, the transmitter must have data to transmit as long as it isn't followed by a stop condition or it will hold SCL low until more data is available. The Master Data Request bit is set when the master transmitter is data-starved. If the master TX FIFO is empty and the last byte did not have a STOP condition flag, then SCL is held low until the CPU writes another byte to transmit. This bit is cleared when a byte is written to the master TX FIFO.

Enum.name: MASTER_TRANSMITTER_D
Enum.description: Master transmitter does not need data.

BitField.name: DRSI
BitField.description: Slave Data Request Interrupt. Once a transmission is started, the transmitter must have data to transmit as long as it isn't followed by a STOP condition or it will hold SCL low until more data is available. The Slave Data Request bit is set when the slave transmitter is data-starved. If the slave TX FIFO is empty and the last byte transmitted was acknowledged, then SCL is held low until the CPU writes another byte to transmit. This bit is cleared when a byte is written to the slave Tx FIFO.

Enum.name: SLAVE_TRANSMITTER_DO
Enum.description: Slave transmitter does not need data.

BitField.name: Active
BitField.description: Indicates whether the bus is busy. This bit is set when a START condition has been seen. It is cleared when a STOP condition is seen..

BitField.name: SCL
BitField.description: The current value of the SCL signal.

BitField.name: SDA
BitField.description: The current value of the SDA signal.

BitField.name: RFF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full (RFF). This bit is set when the RX FIFO is full and cannot accept any more data. It is cleared when the RX FIFO is not full. If a byte arrives when the Receive FIFO is full, the SCL is held low until the CPU reads the RX FIFO and makes room for it.

BitField.name: RFE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Empty. RFE is set when the RX FIFO is empty and is cleared when the RX FIFO contains valid data.

BitField.name: TFF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Full. TFF is set when the TX FIFO is full and is cleared when the TX FIFO is not full.

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. TFE is set when the TX FIFO is empty and is cleared when the TX FIFO contains valid data.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TDIE
BitField.description: Transmit Done Interrupt Enable. This enables the TDI interrupt signalling that this I2C issued a STOP condition.

BitField.name: AFIE
BitField.description: Transmitter Arbitration Failure Interrupt Enable. This enables the AFI interrupt which is asserted during transmission when trying to set SDA high, but the bus is driven low by another device.

BitField.name: NAIE
BitField.description: Transmitter No Acknowledge Interrupt Enable. This enables the NAI interrupt signalling that transmitted byte was not acknowledged.

BitField.name: DRMIE
BitField.description: Master Transmitter Data Request Interrupt Enable. This enables the DRMI interrupt which signals that the master transmitter has run out of data, has not issued a STOP, and is holding the SCL line low.

BitField.name: DRSIE
BitField.description: Slave Transmitter Data Request Interrupt Enable. This enables the DRSI interrupt which signals that the slave transmitter has run out of data and the last byte was acknowledged, so the SCL line is being held low.

BitField.name: REFIE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full Interrupt Enable. This enables the Receive FIFO Full interrupt to indicate that the receive FIFO cannot accept any more data.

BitField.name: RFDAIE
BitField.description: Receive Data Available Interrupt Enable. This enables the DAI interrupt to indicate that data is available in the receive FIFO (i.e. not empty).

BitField.name: TFFIE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full Interrupt Enable. This enables the Transmit FIFO Not Full interrupt to indicate that the more data can be written to the transmit FIFO. Note that this is not full. It is intended help the CPU to write to the I2C block only when there is room in the FIFO and do this without polling the status register.

BitField.name: SRST
BitField.description: Soft reset. This is only needed in unusual circumstances. If a device issues a start condition without issuing a stop condition. A system timer may be used to reset the I2C if the bus remains busy longer than the time-out period. On a soft reset, the Tx and Rx FIFOs are flushed, I2C_STS register is cleared, and all internal state machines are reset to appear idle. The I2C_CLKHI, I2C_CLKLO and I2C_CTL (except Soft Reset Bit) are NOT modified by a soft reset.

Enum.name: RESET_THE_I2C_TO_IDL
Enum.description: Reset the I2C to idle state. Self clearing.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CDHI
BitField.description: Clock divisor high. This value is the number of 48 MHz clocks the serial clock (SCL) will be high.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CDLO
BitField.description: Clock divisor low. This value is the number of 48 MHz clocks the serial clock (SCL) will be low.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: HOST_CLK_EN
BitField.description: Host clock enable

BitField.name: DEV_CLK_EN
BitField.description: Device clock enable

BitField.name: I2C_CLK_EN
BitField.description: I2C clock enable

BitField.name: OTG_CLK_EN
BitField.description: OTG clock enable. In device-only applications, this bit enables access to the PORTSEL register.

BitField.name: AHB_CLK_EN
BitField.description: AHB master clock enable

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: HOST_CLK_ON
BitField.description: Host clock status.

BitField.name: DEV_CLK_ON
BitField.description: Device clock status.

BitField.name: I2C_CLK_ON
BitField.description: I2C clock status.

BitField.name: OTG_CLK_ON
BitField.description: OTG clock status.

BitField.name: AHB_CLK_ON
BitField.description: AHB master clock status.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CRC_POLY
BitField.description: Select CRC polynomial

BitField.name: BIT_RVS_WR
BitField.description: Select bit order for CRC_WR_DATA

Enum.name: NO_BIT_ORDER_REVERSE
Enum.description: No bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte)

Enum.name: BIT_ORDER_REVERSE_FO
Enum.description: Bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte)

BitField.name: CMPL_WR
BitField.description: Select one's complement for CRC_WR_DATA

BitField.name: BIT_RVS_SUM
BitField.description: Select bit order revers for CRC_SUM

Enum.name: NO_BIT_ORDER_REVERSE
Enum.description: No bit order reverse for CRC_SUM

BitField.name: CMPL_SUM
BitField.description: Select one's complement for CRC_SUM

BitField.name: Reserved
BitField.description: Always 0 when read

BitField.name: CRC_SEED
BitField.description: A write access to this register will load CRC seed value to CRC_SUM register with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-processes. A write access to this register will overrule the CRC calculation in progresses.

BitField.name: CRC_SUM
BitField.description: The most recent CRC sum can be read through this register with selected bit order and 1's complement post-processes.

BitField.name: CRC_WR_DATA
BitField.description: Data written to this register will be taken to perform CRC calculation with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-process. Any write size 8, 16 or 32-bit are allowed and accept back-to-back transactions.

BitField.name: PMASK0
BitField.description: Fast GPIO physical pin access control. 0 = Controlled pin is affected by writes to the port's xSET, xCLR, and xPIN register(s). Current state of the pin can be read from the xPIN register. 1 = Controlled pin is not affected by writes into the port's xSET, xCLR and xPIN register(s). When the xPIN register is read, this bit will not be updated with the state of the physical pin.

Register.name: PIN0
Register.description: Port Pin value register using MASK.

BitField.name: VAL0
BitField.description: Fast GPIO output value Set bits. Bit 0 in xCLR corresponds to pin Px[0], bit 31 in xCLR corresponds to pin Px[31]. 0 = Controlled pin output is set to LOW. 1 = Controlled pin output is set to HIGH.

BitField.name: VAL1
BitField.description: Fast GPIO output value Set bits. Bit 0 in xCLR corresponds to pin Px[0], bit 31 in xCLR corresponds to pin Px[31]. 0 = Controlled pin output is set to LOW. 1 = Controlled pin output is set to HIGH.

BitField.description: Fast GPIO output value Clear bits. Bit 0 in xCLR controls pin Px[0], bit 31 controls pin Px[31]. 0 = Controlled pin output is unchanged. 1 = Controlled pin output is set to LOW.

BitField.name: PCLR30
BitField.description: Fast GPIO output value Clear bits. Bit 0 in xCLR controls pin Px[0], bit 31 controls pin Px[31]. 0 = Controlled pin output is unchanged. 1 = Controlled pin output is set to LOW.

BitField.name: PCLR31
BitField.description: Fast GPIO output value Clear bits. Bit 0 in xCLR controls pin Px[0], bit 31 controls pin Px[31]. 0 = Controlled pin output is unchanged. 1 = Controlled pin output is set to LOW.

Register.name: CONTROL
Register.description: Controls operation of the memory controller.

BitField.name: E
BitField.description: EMC Enable. Indicates if the EMC is enabled or disabled:

BitField.name: M
BitField.description: Address mirror. Indicates normal or reset memory map:

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: Reset memory map. Static memory EMC_CS1 is mirrored onto EMC_CS0 and EMC_DYCS0 (POR reset value).

BitField.name: L
BitField.description: Low-power mode. Indicates normal, or low-power mode:

Enum.name: LOWPOWER
Enum.description: Low-power mode. Entering low-power mode reduces memory controller power consumption. Dynamic memory is refreshed as necessary. The memory controller returns to normal functional mode by clearing the low-power mode bit (L), or by POR. This bit must only be modified when the EMC is in idle state.[1]

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: B
BitField.description: Busy. This bit is used to ensure that the memory controller enters the low-power or disabled mode cleanly by determining if the memory controller is busy or not.

Enum.name: BUSY
Enum.description: EMC is busy performing memory transactions, commands, auto-refresh cycles, or is in self-refresh mode (POR reset value).

BitField.name: S
BitField.description: Write buffer status.This bit enables the EMC to enter low-power mode or disabled mode cleanly.

BitField.name: SA
BitField.description: Self-refresh acknowledge. This bit indicates the operating mode of the EMC.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CONFIG
Register.description: Configures operation of the memory controller

BitField.name: EM
BitField.description: Endian mode. On power-on reset, the value of the endian bit is 0. All data must be flushed in the EMC before switching between little-endian and big-endian modes.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CLKR
BitField.description: CCLK: CLKOUT ratio. This bit must contain 0 for proper operation of the EMC.

Enum.name: DONOTUSE
Enum.description: 1:2 (this option is not available on the LPC178x/177x)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CE
BitField.description: Dynamic memory clock enable.

Enum.name: POWERSAVE
Enum.description: Clock enable of idle devices are deasserted to save power (POR reset value).

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: All clock enables are driven HIGH continuously.[1]

BitField.name: CS
BitField.description: Dynamic memory clock control. When clock control is LOW the output clock CLKOUT is stopped when there are no SDRAM transactions. The clock is also stopped during self-refresh mode.

Enum.name: STOP
Enum.description: CLKOUT stops when all SDRAMs are idle and during self-refresh mode.

BitField.name: SR
BitField.description: Self-refresh request, EMCSREFREQ. By writing 1 to this bit self-refresh can be entered under software control. Writing 0 to this bit returns the EMC to normal mode. The self-refresh acknowledge bit in the Status register must be polled to discover the current operating mode of the EMC.[2]

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MMC
BitField.description: Memory clock control.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: I
BitField.description: SDRAM initialization.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Issue SDRAM NORMAL operation command (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: REFRESH
BitField.description: Refresh timer. Indicates the multiple of 16 CCLKs between SDRAM refresh cycles. 0x0 = Refresh disabled (POR reset value). 0x1 - 0x7FF = n x16 = 16n CCLKs between SDRAM refresh cycles. For example: 0x1 = 1 x 16 = 16 CCLKs between SDRAM refresh cycles. 0x8 = 8 x 16 = 128 CCLKs between SDRAM refresh cycles

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RD
BitField.description: Read data strategy

Enum.name: CLOCK_OUT_DELAYED_ST
Enum.description: Clock out delayed strategy, using CLKOUT (command not delayed, clock out delayed). POR reset value.

Enum.name: COMMAND_DELAYED_STRA
Enum.description: Command delayed strategy, using EMCCLKDELAY (command delayed, clock out not delayed).

Enum.name: COMMAND_DELAYED_STRA
Enum.description: Command delayed strategy plus one clock cycle, using EMCCLKDELAY (command delayed, clock out not delayed).

Enum.name: COMMAND_DELAYED_STRA
Enum.description: Command delayed strategy plus two clock cycles, using EMCCLKDELAY (command delayed, clock out not delayed).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TRP
BitField.description: Precharge command period. 0x0 - 0xE = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0xF = 16 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TRAS
BitField.description: Active to precharge command period. 0x0 - 0xE = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0xF = 16 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TSREX
BitField.description: Self-refresh exit time. 0x0 - 0xE = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0xF = 16 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TAPR
BitField.description: Last-data-out to active command time. 0x0 - 0xE = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0xF = 16 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TDAL
BitField.description: Data-in to active command. 0x0 - 0xE = n clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0xF = 15 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TWR
BitField.description: Write recovery time. 0x0 - 0xE = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0xF = 16 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DYNAMICRC
Register.description: Selects the active to active command period.

BitField.name: TRC
BitField.description: Active to active command period. 0x0 - 0x1E = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0x1F = 32 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TRFC
BitField.description: Auto-refresh period and auto-refresh to active command period. 0x0 - 0x1E = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0x1F = 32 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DYNAMICXSR
Register.description: Time for exit self-refresh to active command.

BitField.name: TXSR
BitField.description: Exit self-refresh to active command time. 0x0 - 0x1E = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0x1F = 32 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DYNAMICRRD
Register.description: Latency for active bank A to active bank B.

BitField.name: TRRD
BitField.description: Active bank A to active bank B latency 0x0 - 0xE = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0xF = 16 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DYNAMICMRD
Register.description: Time for load mode register to active command.

BitField.name: TMRD
BitField.description: Load mode register to active command time. 0x0 - 0xE = n + 1 clock cycles. The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0xF = 16 clock cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICEXTENDEDWAIT
Register.description: Time for long static memory read and write transfers.

BitField.name: EXTENDEDWAIT
BitField.description: Extended wait time out. 16 clock cycles (POR reset value). The delay is in CCLK cycles. 0x0 = 16 clock cycles. 0x1 - 0x3FF = (n+1) x16 clock cycles.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: MW
BitField.description: Memory width.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PM
BitField.description: Page mode. In page mode the EMC can burst up to four external accesses. Therefore devices with asynchronous page mode burst four or higher devices are supported. Asynchronous page mode burst two devices are not supported and must be accessed normally.

Enum.name: ASYNCHRONOUS_PAGE_MO
Enum.description: Asynchronous page mode enabled (page length four).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Chip select polarity. The value of the chip select polarity on power-on reset is 0.

BitField.name: PB
BitField.description: Byte lane state. The byte lane state bit, PB, enables different types of memory to be connected. For byte-wide static memories the BLS3:0 signal from the EMC is usually connected to WE (write enable). In this case for reads all the BLS3:0 bits must be HIGH. This means that the byte lane state (PB) bit must be LOW. 16 bit wide static memory devices usually have the BLS3:0 signals connected to the UBn and LBn (upper byte and lower byte) signals in the static memory. In this case a write to a particular byte must assert the appropriate UBn or LBn signal LOW. For reads, all the UB and LB signals must be asserted LOW so that the bus is driven. In this case the byte lane state (PB) bit must be HIGH.

Enum.name: BLSHIGH
Enum.description: For reads all the bits in BLS3:0 are HIGH. For writes the respective active bits in BLS3:0 are LOW (POR reset value).

Enum.name: BLSLOW
Enum.description: For reads the respective active bits in BLS3:0 are LOW. For writes the respective active bits in BLS3:0 are LOW.

BitField.name: EW
BitField.description: Extended wait (EW) uses the EMCStaticExtendedWait register to time both the read and write transfers rather than the EMCStaticWaitRd and EMCStaticWaitWr registers. This enables much longer transactions. [1]

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.description: Buffer enable [2]

BitField.name: P
BitField.description: Write protect

BitField.name: WAITWEN

Register.name: STATICWAITWEN3
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 to write enable.

BitField.name: WAITWEN
BitField.description: Wait write enable. Delay from chip select assertion to write enable. 0x0 = One CCLK cycle delay between assertion of chip select and write enable (POR reset value). 0x1 - 0xF = (n + 1) CCLK cycle delay. The delay is (WAITWEN +1) x tCCLK.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITOEN0
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 or address change, whichever is later, to output enable.

BitField.name: WAITOEN
BitField.description: Wait output enable. Delay from chip select assertion to output enable. 0x0 = No delay (POR reset value). 0x1 - 0xF = n cycle delay. The delay is WAITOEN x tCCLK.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITOEN1
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 or address change, whichever is later, to output enable.

BitField.name: WAITOEN
BitField.description: Wait output enable. Delay from chip select assertion to output enable. 0x0 = No delay (POR reset value). 0x1 - 0xF = n cycle delay. The delay is WAITOEN x tCCLK.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITOEN2
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 or address change, whichever is later, to output enable.

BitField.name: WAITOEN
BitField.description: Wait output enable. Delay from chip select assertion to output enable. 0x0 = No delay (POR reset value). 0x1 - 0xF = n cycle delay. The delay is WAITOEN x tCCLK.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITOEN3
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 or address change, whichever is later, to output enable.

BitField.name: WAITOEN
BitField.description: Wait output enable. Delay from chip select assertion to output enable. 0x0 = No delay (POR reset value). 0x1 - 0xF = n cycle delay. The delay is WAITOEN x tCCLK.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITRD0
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 to a read access.

BitField.name: WAITRD
BitField.description: Non-page mode read wait states or asynchronous page mode read first access wait state. Non-page mode read or asynchronous page mode read, first read only: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n + 1) CCLK cycles for read accesses. For non-sequential reads, the wait state time is (WAITRD + 1) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 32 CCLK cycles for read accesses (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITRD1
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 to a read access.

BitField.name: WAITRD
BitField.description: Non-page mode read wait states or asynchronous page mode read first access wait state. Non-page mode read or asynchronous page mode read, first read only: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n + 1) CCLK cycles for read accesses. For non-sequential reads, the wait state time is (WAITRD + 1) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 32 CCLK cycles for read accesses (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITRD2
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 to a read access.

BitField.name: WAITRD

For non-sequential reads, the wait state time is (WAITRD + 1) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 32 CCLK cycles for read accesses (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITRD3

BitField.name: WAITRD
BitField.description: Non-page mode read wait states or asynchronous page mode read first access wait state. Non-page mode read or asynchronous page mode read, first read only: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n + 1) CCLK cycles for read accesses. For non-sequential reads, the wait state time is (WAITRD + 1) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 32 CCLK cycles for read accesses (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITPAGE0
Register.description: Delay for asynchronous page mode sequential accesses for EMC_CS0.

BitField.name: WAITPAGE
BitField.description: Asynchronous page mode read after the first read wait states. Number of wait states for asynchronous page mode read accesses after the first read: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n+ 1) CCLK cycle read access time. For asynchronous page mode read for sequential reads, the wait state time for page mode accesses after the first read is (WAITPAGE + 1) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 32 CCLK cycle read access time (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITPAGE1
Register.description: Delay for asynchronous page mode sequential accesses for EMC_CS0.

BitField.name: WAITPAGE
BitField.description: Asynchronous page mode read after the first read wait states. Number of wait states for asynchronous page mode read accesses after the first read: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n+ 1) CCLK cycle read access time. For asynchronous page mode read for sequential reads, the wait state time for page mode accesses after the first read is (WAITPAGE + 1) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 32 CCLK cycle read access time (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.description: Delay for asynchronous page mode sequential accesses for EMC_CS0.

BitField.description: Asynchronous page mode read after the first read wait states. Number of wait states for asynchronous page mode read accesses after the first read: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n+ 1) CCLK cycle read access time. For asynchronous page mode read for sequential reads, the wait state time for page mode accesses after the first read is (WAITPAGE + 1) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 32 CCLK cycle read access time (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITPAGE3
Register.description: Delay for asynchronous page mode sequential accesses for EMC_CS0.

BitField.name: WAITPAGE
BitField.description: Asynchronous page mode read after the first read wait states. Number of wait states for asynchronous page mode read accesses after the first read: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n+ 1) CCLK cycle read access time. For asynchronous page mode read for sequential reads, the wait state time for page mode accesses after the first read is (WAITPAGE + 1) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 32 CCLK cycle read access time (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITWR0
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 to a write access.

BitField.name: WAITWR
BitField.description: Write wait states. SRAM wait state time for write accesses after the first read: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n + 2) CCLK cycle write access time. The wait state time for write accesses after the first read is WAITWR (n + 2) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 33 CCLK cycle write access time (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITWR1
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 to a write access.

BitField.name: WAITWR
BitField.description: Write wait states. SRAM wait state time for write accesses after the first read: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n + 2) CCLK cycle write access time. The wait state time for write accesses after the first read is WAITWR (n + 2) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 33 CCLK cycle write access time (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITWR2
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 to a write access.

BitField.name: WAITWR
BitField.description: Write wait states. SRAM wait state time for write accesses after the first read: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n + 2) CCLK cycle write access time. The wait state time for write accesses after the first read is WAITWR (n + 2) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 33 CCLK cycle write access time (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITWR3
Register.description: Delay from EMC_CS0 to a write access.

BitField.name: WAITWR
BitField.description: Write wait states. SRAM wait state time for write accesses after the first read: 0x0 - 0x1E = (n + 2) CCLK cycle write access time. The wait state time for write accesses after the first read is WAITWR (n + 2) x tCCLK. 0x1F = 33 CCLK cycle write access time (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITTURN0
Register.description: Number of bus turnaround cycles EMC_CS0.

BitField.name: WAITTURN
BitField.description: Bus turn-around cycles. 0x0 - 0xE = (n + 1) CCLK turn-around cycles. Bus turn-around time is (WAITTURN + 1) x tCCLK. 0xF = 16 CCLK turn-around cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITTURN1
Register.description: Number of bus turnaround cycles EMC_CS0.

BitField.description: Bus turn-around cycles. 0x0 - 0xE = (n + 1) CCLK turn-around cycles. Bus turn-around time is (WAITTURN + 1) x tCCLK. 0xF = 16 CCLK turn-around cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITTURN2
Register.description: Number of bus turnaround cycles EMC_CS0.

BitField.description: Bus turn-around cycles. 0x0 - 0xE = (n + 1) CCLK turn-around cycles. Bus turn-around time is (WAITTURN + 1) x tCCLK. 0xF = 16 CCLK turn-around cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STATICWAITTURN3
Register.description: Number of bus turnaround cycles EMC_CS0.
