BitField.description: Bus turn-around cycles. 0x0 - 0xE = (n + 1) CCLK turn-around cycles. Bus turn-around time is (WAITTURN + 1) x tCCLK. 0xF = 16 CCLK turn-around cycles (POR reset value).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MOD
Register.description: Watchdog mode register. This register determines the basic mode and status of the Watchdog Timer.

BitField.name: WDEN
BitField.description: Watchdog enable bit. This bit is Set Only. See Table 652.

BitField.name: WDRESET
BitField.description: Watchdog reset enable bit. This bit is Set Only. See Table 652.

Enum.name: NORESET
Enum.description: A watchdog timeout will not cause a chip reset.

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: A watchdog timeout will cause a chip reset.

BitField.name: WDTOF
BitField.description: Watchdog time-out flag. Set when the watchdog timer times out, by a feed error, or by events associated with WDPROTECT, cleared by software. Causes a chip reset if WDRESET = 1. See Section WDTOF.

BitField.name: WDINT
BitField.description: Watchdog interrupt flag. Set when the timer reaches the value in WDWARNINT. Cleared by software. See Section WDINT.

BitField.name: WDPROTECT
BitField.description: Watchdog update mode. This bit is Set Only. See Section WDPROTECT.

Enum.name: CHANGE
Enum.description: The watchdog reload value (WDTC) can be changed at any time.

Enum.name: CHANGE_W_CNT
Enum.description: The watchdog reload value (WDTC) can be changed only after the counter is below the value of WDWARNINT and WDWINDOW. Note: this mode is intended for use only when WDRESET =1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Watchdog timer constant register. The value in this register determines the time-out value.

BitField.name: Count
BitField.description: Watchdog time-out interval.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: FEED
Register.description: Watchdog feed sequence register. Writing 0xAA followed by 0x55 to this register reloads the Watchdog timer with the value contained in WDTC.

BitField.name: Feed
BitField.description: Feed value should be 0xAA followed by 0x55.

Register.name: TV
Register.description: Watchdog timer value register. This register reads out the current value of the Watchdog timer.

BitField.name: Count
BitField.description: Counter timer value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: WARNINT
BitField.description: Watchdog warning interrupt compare value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: WINDOW
BitField.description: Watchdog window value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

BitField.name: MR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 0.

BitField.name: MR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

BitField.name: MR2INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

BitField.name: MR3INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

BitField.name: CR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

BitField.name: CR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: When one, the Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting. When zero, the counters are disabled.

BitField.name: CRST
BitField.description: When one, the Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Timer Counter. The 32 bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Timer counter value.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register. When the Prescale Counter (PC) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

BitField.name: PM
BitField.description: Prescale counter maximum value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter. The 32 bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

BitField.name: MR0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR0

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT
Enum.description: Interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR0R
BitField.description: Reset on MR0

Enum.name: TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_
Enum.description: TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

BitField.name: MR0S
BitField.description: Stop on MR0

Enum.name: TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST
Enum.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR1

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT
Enum.description: Interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR1R
BitField.description: Reset on MR1

Enum.name: TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_
Enum.description: TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

BitField.name: MR1S
BitField.description: Stop on MR1

Enum.name: TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST
Enum.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR2I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR2

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT
Enum.description: Interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR2R
BitField.description: Reset on MR2

Enum.name: TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_
Enum.description: TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

BitField.name: MR2S
BitField.description: Stop on MR2.

Enum.name: TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST
Enum.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC

BitField.name: MR3I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR3

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT
Enum.description: Interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR3R
BitField.description: Reset on MR3

Enum.name: TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_
Enum.description: TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

BitField.name: MR3S
BitField.description: Stop on MR3

Enum.name: TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST
Enum.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MR[0]
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR[1]
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR[2]
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR[3]
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: CCR
Register.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

BitField.name: CAP0RE
BitField.description: Capture on CAPn.0 rising edge

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A sequence of 0 then 1 on CAPn.0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0FE
BitField.description: Capture on CAPn.0 falling edge

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A sequence of 1 then 0 on CAPn.0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CAPn.0 event

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A CR0 load due to a CAPn.0 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: CAP1RE
BitField.description: Capture on CAPn.1 rising edge

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A sequence of 0 then 1 on CAPn.1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1FE
BitField.description: Capture on CAPn.1 falling edge

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A sequence of 1 then 0 on CAPn.1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CAPn.1 event

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A CR1 load due to a CAPn.1 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CR[0]
Register.description: Capture Register 0. CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CAPn.0 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: CR[1]
Register.description: Capture Register 0. CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CAPn.0 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: EMR
Register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the external match pins.

BitField.name: EM0
BitField.description: External Match 0. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 5:4 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

BitField.name: EM1
BitField.description: External Match 1. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 7:6 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.1 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

BitField.name: EM2
BitField.description: External Match 2. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 9:8 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 11:10 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC1
BitField.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC2
BitField.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC3
BitField.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTMODE
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). Timer Mode: the TC is incremented when the Prescale Counter matches the Prescale Register.

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: DUALEDGE
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CINSEL
BitField.description: Count Input Select When bits 1:0 in this register are not 00, these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking. Note: If Counter mode is selected for a particular CAPn input in the TnCTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (TnCCR) must be programmed as 000. However, capture and/or interrupt can be selected for the other 3 CAPn inputs in the same timer.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

BitField.name: MR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 0.

BitField.name: MR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

BitField.name: MR2INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

BitField.name: MR3INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

BitField.name: CR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

BitField.name: CR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: When one, the Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting. When zero, the counters are disabled.

BitField.name: CRST
BitField.description: When one, the Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Timer Counter. The 32 bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Timer counter value.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register. When the Prescale Counter (PC) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

BitField.name: PM
BitField.description: Prescale counter maximum value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter. The 32 bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

BitField.name: MR0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR0

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT
Enum.description: Interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR0R
BitField.description: Reset on MR0

Enum.name: TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_
Enum.description: TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

BitField.name: MR0S
BitField.description: Stop on MR0

Enum.name: TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST
Enum.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR1

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT
Enum.description: Interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR1R
BitField.description: Reset on MR1

Enum.name: TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_
Enum.description: TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

BitField.name: MR1S
BitField.description: Stop on MR1

Enum.name: TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST
Enum.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR2I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR2

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT
Enum.description: Interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR2R
BitField.description: Reset on MR2

Enum.name: TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_
Enum.description: TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

BitField.name: MR2S
BitField.description: Stop on MR2.

Enum.name: TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST
Enum.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC

BitField.name: MR3I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR3

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_IS_GENERAT
Enum.description: Interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR3R
BitField.description: Reset on MR3

Enum.name: TC_WILL_BE_RESET_IF_
Enum.description: TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

BitField.name: MR3S
BitField.description: Stop on MR3

Enum.name: TC_AND_PC_WILL_BE_ST
Enum.description: TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MR[0]
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR[1]
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR[2]
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR[3]
Register.description: Match Register 0. MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: CCR
Register.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

BitField.name: CAP0RE
BitField.description: Capture on CAPn.0 rising edge

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A sequence of 0 then 1 on CAPn.0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0FE
BitField.description: Capture on CAPn.0 falling edge

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A sequence of 1 then 0 on CAPn.0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CAPn.0 event

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A CR0 load due to a CAPn.0 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: CAP1RE
BitField.description: Capture on CAPn.1 rising edge

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A sequence of 0 then 1 on CAPn.1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1FE
BitField.description: Capture on CAPn.1 falling edge

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A sequence of 1 then 0 on CAPn.1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CAPn.1 event

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A CR1 load due to a CAPn.1 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CR[0]
Register.description: Capture Register 0. CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CAPn.0 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: CR[1]
Register.description: Capture Register 0. CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CAPn.0 input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: EMR
Register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the external match pins.

BitField.name: EM0
BitField.description: External Match 0. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 5:4 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

BitField.name: EM1
BitField.description: External Match 1. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 7:6 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.1 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

BitField.name: EM2
BitField.description: External Match 2. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 9:8 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go low, go high, or do nothing, depending on bits 11:10 of this register. This bit can be driven onto a MATn.0 pin, in a positive-logic manner (0 = low, 1 = high).

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC1
BitField.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC2
BitField.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC3
BitField.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MATn.m pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MATn.m pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTMODE
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). Timer Mode: the TC is incremented when the Prescale Counter matches the Prescale Register.

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: DUALEDGE
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CINSEL
BitField.description: Count Input Select When bits 1:0 in this register are not 00, these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking. Note: If Counter mode is selected for a particular CAPn input in the TnCTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (TnCCR) must be programmed as 000. However, capture and/or interrupt can be selected for the other 3 CAPn inputs in the same timer.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RBR
Register.description: Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read (DLAB =0).

BitField.name: RBR
BitField.description: The UARTn Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the UARTn Rx FIFO.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: THR
Register.description: Transmit Holding Regiter. The next character to be transmitted is written here (DLAB =0).

BitField.name: THR
BitField.description: Writing to the UARTn Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the UARTn transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it reaches the bottom of the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: DLL
Register.description: Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider (DLAB =1).

BitField.name: DLLSB
BitField.description: The UARTn Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the UnDLM register, determines the baud rate of the UARTn.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: DLM
Register.description: Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider (DLAB =1).

BitField.name: DLMSB
BitField.description: The UARTn Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the U0DLL register, determines the baud rate of the UARTn.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IER
Register.description: Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential UART interrupts (DLAB =0).

BitField.name: RBRIE
BitField.description: RBR Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt for UARTn. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: THREIE
BitField.description: THRE Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt for UARTn. The status of this can be read from UnLSR[5].

BitField.name: RXIE
BitField.description: RX Line Status Interrupt Enable. Enables the UARTn RX line status interrupts. The status of this interrupt can be read from UnLSR[4:1].

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_RX_LINE_
Enum.description: Disable the RX line status interrupts.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_RX_LINE_S
Enum.description: Enable the RX line status interrupts.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ABEOINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

BitField.name: ABTOINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the auto-baud time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IIR
Register.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

BitField.name: INTSTATUS
BitField.description: Interrupt status. Note that UnIIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating UnIIR[3:1].

Enum.name: AT_LEAST_ONE_INTERRU
Enum.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

BitField.name: INTID
BitField.description: Interrupt identification. UnIER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the UARTn Rx or TX FIFO. All other combinations of UnIER[3:1] not listed below are reserved (000,100,101,111).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: FIFOENABLE
BitField.description: Copies of UnFCR[0].

BitField.name: ABEOINT
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: ABTOINT
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: FCR
Register.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls UART FIFO usage and modes.

BitField.name: FIFOEN
BitField.description: FIFO Enable.

Enum.name: UARTN_FIFOS_ARE_DISA
Enum.description: UARTn FIFOs are disabled. Must not be used in the application.

Enum.name: ACTIVE_HIGH_ENABLE_F
Enum.description: Active high enable for both UARTn Rx and TX FIFOs and UnFCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper UART operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the related UART FIFOs.

BitField.name: RXFIFORES
BitField.description: RX FIFO Reset.

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_
Enum.description: No impact on either of UARTn FIFOs.

Enum.name: WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to UnFCR[1] will clear all bytes in UARTn Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: TXFIFORES
BitField.description: TX FIFO Reset.

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_
Enum.description: No impact on either of UARTn FIFOs.

Enum.name: WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to UnFCR[2] will clear all bytes in UARTn TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: DMAMODE
BitField.description: DMA Mode Select. When the FIFO enable (bit 0 of this register) is set, this bit selects the DMA mode. See Section 18.6.6.1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RXTRIGLVL
BitField.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver UARTn FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt or DMA request is activated.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: LCR
Register.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

BitField.name: WLS
BitField.description: Word Length Select.

BitField.name: SBS
BitField.description: Stop Bit Select

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Enable.

BitField.name: PS
BitField.description: Parity Select

Enum.name: ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O
Enum.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

Enum.name: EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_
Enum.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

BitField.name: BC
BitField.description: Break Control

Enum.name: ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI
Enum.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin UARTn TXD is forced to logic 0 when UnLCR[6] is active high.

BitField.name: DLAB
BitField.description: Divisor Latch Access Bit

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: LSR
Register.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

BitField.name: RDR
BitField.description: Receiver Data Ready. UnLSR[0] is set when the UnRBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the UARTn RBR FIFO is empty.

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: The UARTn receiver FIFO is empty.

Enum.name: NOTEMPTY
Enum.description: The UARTn receiver FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: OE
BitField.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[1]. UnLSR[1] is set when UARTn RSR has a new character assembled and the UARTn RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the UARTn RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the UARTn RSR will be lost.

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: FE
BitField.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Upon detection of a framing error, the Rx will attempt to resynchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: BI
BitField.description: Break Interrupt. When RXDn is held in the spacing state (all zeroes) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXDn goes to marking state (all ones). An UnLSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: THRE
BitField.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty. THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty UARTn THR and is cleared on a UnTHR write.

BitField.name: TEMT
BitField.description: Transmitter Empty. TEMT is set when both UnTHR and UnTSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the UnTSR or the UnTHR contain valid data.

Enum.name: VALIDDATA
Enum.description: UnTHR and/or the UnTSR contains valid data.

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: UnTHR and the UnTSR are empty.

BitField.name: RXFE
BitField.description: Error in RX FIFO . UnLSR[7] is set when a character with a Rx error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the UnRBR. This bit is cleared when the UnLSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the UARTn FIFO.

Enum.name: NOERROR
Enum.description: UnRBR contains no UARTn RX errors or UnFCR[0]=0.

Enum.name: ERRORS
Enum.description: UARTn RBR contains at least one UARTn RX error.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCR
Register.description: Scratch Pad Register. 8-bit temporary storage for software.

BitField.name: PAD
BitField.description: A readable, writable byte.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: ACR
Register.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

Enum.name: AUTO_BAUD_START_AUT
Enum.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Auto-baud mode select bit.

BitField.name: AUTORESTART
BitField.description: Restart bit.

Enum.name: RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T
Enum.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next UARTn Rx falling edge)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ABEOINTCLR
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: ABTOINTCLR
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: FDR
Register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

BitField.name: DIVADDVAL
BitField.description: Baud-rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud-rate generator will not impact the UARTn baudrate.

BitField.name: MULVAL
BitField.description: Baud-rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UARTn to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud-rate generator is used or not.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TER
Register.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off UART transmitter for use with software flow control.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TXEN
BitField.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit is cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software implementing software-handshaking can clear this bit when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RS485CTRL
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

BitField.name: NMMEN
BitField.description: NMM enable.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte has the parity bit = 1, generating a received data interrupt. See Section 18.6.16 RS-485/EIA-485 modes of operation.

BitField.name: RXDIS
BitField.description: Receiver enable.

BitField.name: AADEN
BitField.description: AAD enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DCTRL
BitField.description: Direction control enable.

BitField.name: OINV
BitField.description: Direction control pin polarity. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the Un_OE pin.

Enum.name: DIRLOW
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

Enum.name: DIRHIGH
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

BitField.name: ADRMATCH
BitField.description: Contains the address match value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLY
BitField.description: Contains the direction control (UnOE) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RBR
Register.description: DLAB =0 Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read.

BitField.name: RBR
BitField.description: The UART1 Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the UART1 RX FIFO.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: THR
Register.description: DLAB =0. Transmit Holding Register. The next character to be transmitted is written here.

BitField.name: THR
BitField.description: Writing to the UART1 Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the UART1 transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it reaches the bottom of the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: DLL
Register.description: DLAB =1. Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider.

BitField.name: DLLSB
BitField.description: The UART1 Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the U1DLM register, determines the baud rate of the UART1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: DLM
Register.description: DLAB =1. Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider.

BitField.name: DLMSB
BitField.description: The UART1 Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the U1DLL register, determines the baud rate of the UART1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IER
Register.description: DLAB =0. Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential UART1 interrupts.

BitField.name: RBRIE
BitField.description: RBR Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt for UART1. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: THREIE
BitField.description: THRE Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt for UART1. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[5].

BitField.name: RXIE
BitField.description: RX Line Interrupt Enable. Enables the UART1 RX line status interrupts. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[4:1].

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_RX_LINE_
Enum.description: Disable the RX line status interrupts.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_RX_LINE_S
Enum.description: Enable the RX line status interrupts.

BitField.name: MSIE
BitField.description: Modem Status Interrupt Enable. Enables the modem interrupt. The status of this interrupt can be read from MSR[3:0].

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: CTSIE
BitField.description: CTS Interrupt Enable. If auto-cts mode is enabled this bit enables/disables the modem status interrupt generation on a CTS1 signal transition. If auto-cts mode is disabled a CTS1 transition will generate an interrupt if Modem Status Interrupt Enable (IER[3]) is set. In normal operation a CTS1 signal transition will generate a Modem Status Interrupt unless the interrupt has been disabled by clearing the IER[3] bit in the IER register. In auto-cts mode a transition on the CTS1 bit will trigger an interrupt only if both the IER[3] and IER[7] bits are set.

BitField.name: ABEOIE
BitField.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

BitField.name: ABTOIE
BitField.description: Enables the auto-baud time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IIR
Register.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

BitField.name: INTSTATUS
BitField.description: Interrupt status. Note that IIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating IIR[3:1].

Enum.name: AT_LEAST_ONE_INTERRU
Enum.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

BitField.name: INTID
BitField.description: Interrupt identification. IER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the UART1 Rx or TX FIFO. All other combinations of IER[3:1] not listed below are reserved (100,101,111).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: FIFOENABLE
BitField.description: Copies of FCR[0].

BitField.name: ABEOINT
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: ABTOINT
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FCR
Register.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls UART1 FIFO usage and modes.

BitField.name: FIFOEN
BitField.description: FIFO enable.

Enum.name: MUST_NOT_BE_USED_IN_
Enum.description: Must not be used in the application.

Enum.name: ACTIVE_HIGH_ENABLE_F
Enum.description: Active high enable for both UART1 Rx and TX FIFOs and FCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper UART1 operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the UART1 FIFOs.

BitField.name: RXFIFORES
BitField.description: RX FIFO Reset.

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_
Enum.description: No impact on either of UART1 FIFOs.

Enum.name: WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[1] will clear all bytes in UART1 Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: TXFIFORES
BitField.description: TX FIFO Reset.

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_
Enum.description: No impact on either of UART1 FIFOs.

Enum.name: WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[2] will clear all bytes in UART1 TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: DMAMODE
BitField.description: DMA Mode Select. When the FIFO enable bit (bit 0 of this register) is set, this bit selects the DMA mode. See Section 36.6.6.1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RXTRIGLVL
BitField.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver UART1 FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt is activated.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits.

Register.name: LCR
Register.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

BitField.name: WLS
BitField.description: Word Length Select.

BitField.name: SBS
BitField.description: Stop Bit Select.

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Enable.

BitField.name: PS
BitField.description: Parity Select.

Enum.name: ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O
Enum.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

Enum.name: EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_
Enum.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

BitField.name: BC
BitField.description: Break Control.

Enum.name: ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI
Enum.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin UART1 TXD is forced to logic 0 when LCR[6] is active high.

BitField.name: DLAB
BitField.description: Divisor Latch Access Bit (DLAB)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Modem Control Register. Contains controls for flow control handshaking and loopback mode.

BitField.name: DTRCTRL
BitField.description: DTR Control. Source for modem output pin, DTR. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

BitField.name: RTSCTRL
BitField.description: RTS Control. Source for modem output pin RTS. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: LMS
BitField.description: Loopback Mode Select. The modem loopback mode provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing. Serial data from the transmitter is connected internally to serial input of the receiver. Input pin, RXD1, has no effect on loopback and output pin, TXD1 is held in marking state. The 4 modem inputs (CTS, DSR, RI and DCD) are disconnected externally. Externally, the modem outputs (RTS, DTR) are set inactive. Internally, the 4 modem outputs are connected to the 4 modem inputs. As a result of these connections, the upper 4 bits of the MSR will be driven by the lower 4 bits of the MCR rather than the 4 modem inputs in normal mode. This permits modem status interrupts to be generated in loopback mode by writing the lower 4 bits of MCR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RTSEN
BitField.description: RTS enable.

BitField.name: CTSEN
BitField.description: CTS enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: LSR
Register.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

BitField.name: RDR
BitField.description: Receiver Data Ready. LSR[0] is set when the RBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the UART1 RBR FIFO is empty.

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: The UART1 receiver FIFO is empty.

Enum.name: NOTEMPTY
Enum.description: The UART1 receiver FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: OE
BitField.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. An LSR read clears LSR[1]. LSR[1] is set when UART1 RSR has a new character assembled and the UART1 RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the UART1 RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the UART1 RSR will be lost.

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. An LSR read clears LSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the UART1 RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: FE
BitField.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. An LSR read clears LSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on FCR0. Upon detection of a framing error, the RX will attempt to resynchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the UART1 RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: BI
BitField.description: Break Interrupt. When RXD1 is held in the spacing state (all zeroes) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXD1 goes to marking state (all ones). An LSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the UART1 RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: THRE
BitField.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty. THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty UART1 THR and is cleared on a THR write.

BitField.name: TEMT
BitField.description: Transmitter Empty. TEMT is set when both THR and TSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the TSR or the THR contain valid data.

Enum.name: VALID
Enum.description: THR and/or the TSR contains valid data.

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: THR and the TSR are empty.

BitField.name: RXFE
BitField.description: Error in RX FIFO. LSR[7] is set when a character with a RX error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the RBR. This bit is cleared when the LSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the UART1 FIFO.

Enum.name: NOERROR
Enum.description: RBR contains no UART1 RX errors or FCR[0]=0.

Enum.name: ERRORS
Enum.description: UART1 RBR contains at least one UART1 RX error.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MSR
Register.description: Modem Status Register. Contains handshake signal status flags.

BitField.name: DCTS
BitField.description: Delta CTS. Set upon state change of input CTS. Cleared on an MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, CTS.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input, CTS.

BitField.name: DDSR
BitField.description: Delta DSR. Set upon state change of input DSR. Cleared on an MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, DSR.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input, DSR.

BitField.name: TERI
BitField.description: Trailing Edge RI. Set upon low to high transition of input RI. Cleared on an MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, RI.

BitField.name: DDCD
BitField.description: Delta DCD. Set upon state change of input DCD. Cleared on an MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, DCD.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input, DCD.

BitField.name: CTS
BitField.description: Clear To Send State. Complement of input signal CTS. This bit is connected to MCR[1] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: DSR
BitField.description: Data Set Ready State. Complement of input signal DSR. This bit is connected to MCR[0] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: RI
BitField.description: Ring Indicator State. Complement of input RI. This bit is connected to MCR[2] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: DCD
BitField.description: Data Carrier Detect State. Complement of input DCD. This bit is connected to MCR[3] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCR
Register.description: Scratch Pad Register. 8-bit temporary storage for software.

BitField.name: Pad
BitField.description: A readable, writable byte.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: ACR
Register.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Auto-baud start bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

Enum.name: START
Enum.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Auto-baud mode select bit.

BitField.name: AUTORESTART
BitField.description: Auto-baud restart bit.

Enum.name: RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T
Enum.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next UART1 Rx falling edge)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: ABEOINTCLR
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write-only).

Enum.name: WRITING_A_1_WILL_CLE
Enum.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: ABTOINTCLR
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write-only).

Enum.name: WRITING_A_1_WILL_CLE
Enum.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FDR
Register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

BitField.name: DIVADDVAL
BitField.description: Baud rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud rate generator will not impact the UART1 baud rate.

BitField.name: MULVAL
BitField.description: Baud rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UART1 to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud rate generator is used or not.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TER
Register.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off UART transmitter for use with software flow control.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TXEN
BitField.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software can clear this bit when it detects that the a hardware-handshaking TX-permit signal (CTS) has gone false, or with software handshaking, when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it detects that the TX-permit signal has gone true, or when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RS485CTRL
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

BitField.name: NMMEN
BitField.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) mode select.

Enum.name: ENABLED_IN_THIS_MOD
Enum.description: Enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte causes the UART to set the parity error and generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: RXDIS
BitField.description: Receive enable.

BitField.name: AADEN
BitField.description: Auto Address Detect (AAD) enable.

BitField.name: SEL
BitField.description: Direction control.

Enum.name: RTS_IF_DIRECTION_CO
Enum.description: RTS. If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin RTS is used for direction control.

Enum.name: DTR_IF_DIRECTION_CO
Enum.description: DTR. If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin DTR is used for direction control.

BitField.name: DCTRL
BitField.description: Direction control enable.

BitField.name: OINV
BitField.description: Polarity. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the RTS (or DTR) pin.

Enum.name: LOW_THE_DIRECTION_C
Enum.description: LOW. The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

Enum.name: HIGH_THE_DIRECTION_
Enum.description: HIGH. The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

BitField.name: ADRMATCH
BitField.description: Contains the address match value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLY
BitField.description: Contains the direction control (RTS or DTR) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts, or read to identify which PWM interrupt sources are pending.

BitField.name: PWMMR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 0.

BitField.name: PWMMR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 1.

BitField.name: PWMMR2INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 2.

BitField.name: PWMMR3INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 3.

BitField.name: PWMCAP0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture input 0

BitField.name: PWMCAP1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture input 1 (available in PWM1IR only; this bit is reserved in PWM0IR).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PWMMR4INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 4.

BitField.name: PWMMR5INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 5.

BitField.name: PWMMR6INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 6.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions.

BitField.name: CE
BitField.description: Counter Enable

Enum.name: THE_PWM_TIMER_COUNTE
Enum.description: The PWM Timer Counter and PWM Prescale Counter are enabled for counting.

BitField.name: CR
BitField.description: Counter Reset

Enum.name: THE_PWM_TIMER_COUNTE
Enum.description: The PWM Timer Counter and the PWM Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until this bit is returned to zero.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PWMEN
BitField.description: PWM Enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled (counter resets to 1). PWM mode causes the shadow registers to operate in connection with the Match registers. A program write to a Match register will not have an effect on the Match result until the corresponding bit in PWMLER has been set, followed by the occurrence of a PWM Match 0 event. Note that the PWM Match register that determines the PWM rate (PWM Match Register 0 - MR0) must be set up prior to the PWM being enabled. Otherwise a Match event will not occur to cause shadow register contents to become effective.

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_IS_ENABLE
Enum.description: Timer mode is enabled (counter resets to 0).

BitField.name: MDIS
BitField.description: Master Disable (PWM0 only). The two PWMs may be synchronized using the Master Disable control bit. The Master disable bit of the Master PWM (PWM0 module) controls a secondary enable input to both PWMs, as shown in Figure 141. This bit has no function in the Slave PWM (PWM1).

Enum.name: MASTER_USE_PWM0_IS_
Enum.description: Master use. PWM0 is the master, and both PWMs are enabled for counting.

Enum.name: INDIVIDUAL_USE_THE_
Enum.description: Individual use. The PWMs are used independently, and the individual Counter Enable bits are used to control the PWMs.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Timer Counter. The 32 bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Timer counter value.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register. Determines how often the PWM counter is incremented.

BitField.name: PM
BitField.description: Prescale counter maximum value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter. Prescaler for the main PWM counter.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control whether an interrupt is generated and if the PWM counter is reset when a Match occurs.

BitField.name: PWMMR0I
BitField.description: Interrupt PWM0

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR0
Enum.description: Interrupt on PWMMR0: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR0 matches the value in the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR0R
BitField.description: Reset PWM0

Enum.name: RESET_ON_PWMMR0_THE
Enum.description: Reset on PWMMR0: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR0 matches it.

BitField.name: PWMMR0S
BitField.description: Stop PWM0

Enum.name: STOP_ON_PWMMR0_THE_
Enum.description: Stop on PWMMR0: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR0 matches the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR1I
BitField.description: Interrupt PWM1

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR1
Enum.description: Interrupt on PWMMR1: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR1 matches the value in the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR1R
BitField.description: Reset PWM1

Enum.name: RESET_ON_PWMMR1_THE
Enum.description: Reset on PWMMR1: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR1 matches it.

BitField.name: PWMMR1S
BitField.description: Stop PWM1

Enum.name: STOP_ON_PWMMR1_THE_
Enum.description: Stop on PWMMR1: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR1 matches the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR2I
BitField.description: Interrupt PWM0

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR2
Enum.description: Interrupt on PWMMR2: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR2 matches the value in the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR2R
BitField.description: Reset PWM0

Enum.name: RESET_ON_PWMMR2_THE
Enum.description: Reset on PWMMR2: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR2 matches it.

BitField.name: PWMMR2S
BitField.description: Stop PWM0

Enum.name: STOP_ON_PWMMR2_THE_
Enum.description: Stop on PWMMR2: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR0 matches the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR3I
BitField.description: Interrupt PWM3

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR3
Enum.description: Interrupt on PWMMR3: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR3 matches the value in the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR3R
BitField.description: Reset PWM3

Enum.name: RESET_ON_PWMMR3_THE
Enum.description: Reset on PWMMR3: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR3 matches it.

BitField.name: PWMMR3S
BitField.description: Stop PWM0

Enum.name: STOP_ON_PWMMR3_THE_
Enum.description: Stop on PWMMR3: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR0 matches the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR4I
BitField.description: Interrupt PWM4

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR4
Enum.description: Interrupt on PWMMR4: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR4 matches the value in the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR4R
BitField.description: Reset PWM4

Enum.name: RESET_ON_PWMMR4_THE
Enum.description: Reset on PWMMR4: the PWMTC will be reset if PWMMR4 matches it.

BitField.name: PWMMR4S
BitField.description: Stop PWM4

Enum.name: STOP_ON_PWMMR4_THE_
Enum.description: Stop on PWMMR4: the PWMTC and PWMPC will be stopped and PWMTCR bit 0 will be set to 0 if PWMMR4 matches the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR5I
BitField.description: Interrupt PWM5

Enum.name: INTERRUPT_ON_PWMMR5
Enum.description: Interrupt on PWMMR5: an interrupt is generated when PWMMR5 matches the value in the PWMTC.

BitField.name: PWMMR5R

Register.name: LER
Register.description: Load Enable Register. Enables use of updated PWM match values.

BitField.name: MAT0LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 0 Latch. PWM MR0 register update control. Writing a one to this bit allows the last value written to the PWM Match Register 0 to be become effective when the timer is next reset by a PWM Match event. See Section 27.6.7.

BitField.name: MAT1LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 1 Latch. PWM MR1 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT2LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 2 Latch. PWM MR2 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT3LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 3 Latch. PWM MR3 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT4LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 4 Latch. PWM MR4 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT5LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 5 Latch. PWM MR5 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT6LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 6 Latch. PWM MR6 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: MOD
BitField.description: Counter/ Timer Mode

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_THE_TC_I
Enum.description: Timer Mode: the TC is incremented when the Prescale Counter matches the Prescale register.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_COUNTER_
Enum.description: Rising edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on rising edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_COUNTER
Enum.description: Falling edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on falling edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: DUAL_EDGE_COUNTER_MO
Enum.description: Dual edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on both edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. When bits 1:0 are not 00, these bits select which PWM_CAP pin carries the signal used to increment the TC. Other combinations are reserved.

Enum.name: FOR_PWM0_00_EQ_PWM0_
Enum.description: For PWM0: 00 = PWM0_CAP0 (Other combinations are reserved) For PWM1: 00 = PWM1_CAP0, 01 = PWM1_CAP1 (Other combinations are reserved)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts, or read to identify which PWM interrupt sources are pending.

BitField.name: PWMMR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 0.

BitField.name: PWMMR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 1.

BitField.name: PWMMR2INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 2.

BitField.name: PWMMR3INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 3.

BitField.name: PWMCAP0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture input 0

BitField.name: PWMCAP1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture input 1 (available in PWM1IR only; this bit is reserved in PWM0IR).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PWMMR4INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 4.

BitField.name: PWMMR5INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 5.

BitField.name: PWMMR6INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for PWM match channel 6.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions.

BitField.name: CE
BitField.description: Counter Enable

Enum.name: THE_PWM_TIMER_COUNTE
Enum.description: The PWM Timer Counter and PWM Prescale Counter are enabled for counting.

BitField.name: CR
BitField.description: Counter Reset

Enum.name: THE_PWM_TIMER_COUNTE
Enum.description: The PWM Timer Counter and the PWM Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until this bit is returned to zero.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PWMEN
BitField.description: PWM Enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled (counter resets to 1). PWM mode causes the shadow registers to operate in connection with the Match registers. A program write to a Match register will not have an effect on the Match result until the corresponding bit in PWMLER has been set, followed by the occurrence of a PWM Match 0 event. Note that the PWM Match register that determines the PWM rate (PWM Match Register 0 - MR0) must be set up prior to the PWM being enabled. Otherwise a Match event will not occur to cause shadow register contents to become effective.

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_IS_ENABLE
Enum.description: Timer mode is enabled (counter resets to 0).

BitField.name: MDIS
BitField.description: Master Disable (PWM0 only). The two PWMs may be synchronized using the Master Disable control bit. The Master disable bit of the Master PWM (PWM0 module) controls a secondary enable input to both PWMs, as shown in Figure 141. This bit has no function in the Slave PWM (PWM1).

Enum.name: MASTER_USE_PWM0_IS_
Enum.description: Master use. PWM0 is the master, and both PWMs are enabled for counting.

Enum.name: INDIVIDUAL_USE_THE_
Enum.description: Individual use. The PWMs are used independently, and the individual Counter Enable bits are used to control the PWMs.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Timer Counter. The 32 bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Timer counter value.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register. Determines how often the PWM counter is incremented.

BitField.name: PM
BitField.description: Prescale counter maximum value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter. Prescaler for the main PWM counter.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control whether an interrupt is generated and if the PWM counter is reset when a Match occurs.
