Register.name: LER
Register.description: Load Enable Register. Enables use of updated PWM match values.

BitField.name: MAT0LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 0 Latch. PWM MR0 register update control. Writing a one to this bit allows the last value written to the PWM Match Register 0 to be become effective when the timer is next reset by a PWM Match event. See Section 27.6.7.

BitField.name: MAT1LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 1 Latch. PWM MR1 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT2LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 2 Latch. PWM MR2 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT3LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 3 Latch. PWM MR3 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT4LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 4 Latch. PWM MR4 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT5LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 5 Latch. PWM MR5 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: MAT6LATCHEN
BitField.description: Enable PWM Match 6 Latch. PWM MR6 register update control. See bit 0 for details.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: MOD
BitField.description: Counter/ Timer Mode

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_THE_TC_I
Enum.description: Timer Mode: the TC is incremented when the Prescale Counter matches the Prescale register.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_COUNTER_
Enum.description: Rising edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on rising edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_COUNTER
Enum.description: Falling edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on falling edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: DUAL_EDGE_COUNTER_MO
Enum.description: Dual edge counter Mode: the TC is incremented on both edges of the PWM_CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. When bits 1:0 are not 00, these bits select which PWM_CAP pin carries the signal used to increment the TC. Other combinations are reserved.

Enum.name: FOR_PWM0_00_EQ_PWM0_
Enum.description: For PWM0: 00 = PWM0_CAP0 (Other combinations are reserved) For PWM1: 00 = PWM1_CAP0, 01 = PWM1_CAP1 (Other combinations are reserved)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CONSET
Register.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AA
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge flag.

BitField.name: SI
BitField.description: I2C interrupt flag.

BitField.name: STO
BitField.description: STOP flag.

BitField.name: STA
BitField.description: START flag.

BitField.name: I2EN
BitField.description: I2C interface enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: These bits are unused and are always 0.

BitField.name: Status
BitField.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I 2C interface.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAT
Register.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR0
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLH
Register.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLL
Register.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. SCLL and SCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: Count for SCL low time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CONCLR
Register.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AAC
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge Clear bit.

BitField.name: SIC
BitField.description: I2C interrupt Clear bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: STAC
BitField.description: START flag Clear bit.

BitField.name: I2ENC
BitField.description: I2C interface Disable bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MM_ENA
BitField.description: Monitor mode enable.

Enum.name: THE_I_2C_MODULE_WILL
Enum.description: The I 2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

BitField.name: ENA_SCL
BitField.description: SCL output enable.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET
Enum.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

BitField.name: MATCH_ALL
BitField.description: Select interrupt register match.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above. That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET
Enum.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

Register.name: ADR1
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR2
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR3
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DATA_BUFFER
Register.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: CMP_PD_IREF
BitField.description: Controls the current source used by the comparators. These bits must be set when either comparator is used.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The comparator current source is disabled.

Enum.name: DIS_DEEPSLP_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The comparator current source is disabled in Deep Sleep and Power-down modes and restored automatically when exiting those modes.

Enum.name: DIS_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The comparator current source is disabled in Power-down mode and restored automatically when exiting Power-down.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The comparator current source is powered up.

BitField.name: CMP_PD_VBG
BitField.description: Controls the bandgap reference source that is used by the comparators. These bits must be set when either comparator is used.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The comparator bandgap reference is disabled.

Enum.name: DIS_DEEPSLP_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The comparator bandgap reference is disabled in Deep Sleep and Power-down modes and restored automatically when exiting those modes.

Enum.name: DIS_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The comparator bandgap reference is disabled in Power-down mode and restored automatically when exiting Power-down.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The comparator bandgap reference is powered up.

BitField.name: CMP_VTEMP
BitField.description: Controls the voltage reference of the temperature sensor. These bits must be set when the temperature sensor is used.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The temperature sensor voltage reference is disabled.

Enum.name: DIS_DEEPSLP_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The temperature sensor voltage reference is disabled in Deep Sleep and Power-down modes and restored automatically when exiting those modes.

Enum.name: DIS_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The temperature sensor voltage reference is disabled in Power-down mode and restored automatically when exiting Power-down.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The temperature sensor voltage reference is powered up.

BitField.name: CMP_TEMPSEN
BitField.description: Enables the temperature sensor. These bits must be set when the temperature sensor is used.

Enum.name: DIS_DEEPSLP_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The temperature sensor is disabled in Deep Sleep and Power-down modes and restored automatically when exiting those modes.

Enum.name: DIS_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The temperature sensor is disabled in Power-down mode and restored automatically when exiting Power-down.

BitField.name: CMP_ROSCCTL
BitField.description: Selects the inputs for the flip/flops that provide the CMP_ROSC output.

Enum.name: CMP1
Enum.description: The CMP_ROSC output is set by CMP1 and reset by CMP0.

Enum.name: CMP0
Enum.description: The CMP_ROSC output is set by CMP0 and reset by CMP1.

BitField.name: CMP_EXT_RESET
BitField.description: Selects the reset source for the CMP_ROSC output.

Enum.name: INTRESET
Enum.description: The CMP_ROSC output is reset by the internal chip reset.

Enum.name: CMP_RESETIN
Enum.description: The CMP_ROSC output is reset by the CMP_RESET input.

BitField.name: CMP_T0CAP2
BitField.description: Selects the input for Timer 0 capture input 2.

Enum.name: COMP0
Enum.description: T0CAP2 is connected to comparator 0 level output.

Enum.name: COMP1
Enum.description: T0CAP2 is connected to comparator 1 level output.

BitField.name: CMP_T0CAP3
BitField.description: Selects the input for Timer 0 capture input 3.

Enum.name: COMP0
Enum.description: T0CAP3 is connected to comparator 0 edge output.

Enum.name: COMP1
Enum.description: T0CAP3 is connected to comparator 1 edge output.

BitField.name: CMP_T1CAP2
BitField.description: Selects the input for Timer 1 capture input 2.

Enum.name: COMP1
Enum.description: T1CAP2 is connected to comparator 1 edge output.

Enum.name: COMP0
Enum.description: T1CAP2 is connected to comparator 0 level output.

BitField.name: CMP_T1CAP3
BitField.description: Selects the input for Timer 1 capture input 3.

Enum.name: COMP1
Enum.description: T1CAP3 is connected to comparator 1 level output.

Enum.name: COMP0
Enum.description: T1CAP3 is connected to comparator 0 edge output.

BitField.name: CMP0_EN
BitField.description: Comparator 0 enable control.

Enum.name: DIS_DEEPSLP_PWRDWN
Enum.description: Comparator 0 is disabled in Deep Sleep and Power-down modes and re-enabled automatically when exiting those modes.

Enum.name: DIS_PWRDWN
Enum.description: Comparator 0 is disabled in Power-down mode and re-enabled automatically when exiting Power-down.

BitField.name: CMP0_OE
BitField.description: Comparator 0 output enable.

BitField.name: CMP0_STAT
BitField.description: Comparator 0 status. This bit reflects the comparator 0 output, and is not affected by CMP0_OE.

BitField.name: CMP0_VM
BitField.description: Comparator 0 VM input select.

BitField.name: CMP0_VP
BitField.description: Comparator 0 VP input select.

BitField.name: CMP0_SYNC
BitField.description: Comparator 0 output synchronization control.

Enum.name: DIRECT
Enum.description: The comparator 0 output is used directly.

Enum.name: SYNCH
Enum.description: The comparator 0 output is synchronized with the internal bus clock for output to other peripherals.

BitField.name: CMP0_HYS
BitField.description: Comparator 0 hysteresis control. When enabled, hysteresis determines the difference required between the comparator inputs before the comparator output switches. The difference must be in the direction opposite of the current comparator output.

Enum.name: HYSTERESISOFF
Enum.description: Hysteresis is turned off, comparator output will change as the input voltages cross.

BitField.name: CMP0_INTPOL
BitField.description: Selects the polarity of the CMP0 output for purposes of generating level interrupts. See Table 412.

Enum.name: NOTINVERTED
Enum.description: The CMP0 output is used as-is for generating interrupts.

Enum.name: INVERTED
Enum.description: The CMP0 output is used inverted for generating interrupts.

BitField.name: CMP0_INTTYPE
BitField.description: Select comparator 0 interrupt type. See Table 412.

BitField.name: CMP0_INTEDGE
BitField.description: Select edge triggered interrupt to be active on either high or low transitions, when CMP0_IntType = 0. See Table 412.

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: Comparator 0 interrupt is active on falling edges.

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: Comparator 0 interrupt is active on rising edges.

Enum.name: DUALEDGE
Enum.description: Comparator 0 Interrupt is active on both edges.

BitField.name: CMP0_INTFLAG
BitField.description: Comparator 0 interrupt flag.

Enum.name: NOTPENDING
Enum.description: The Comparator 0 interrupt is not pending.

Enum.name: PENDING
Enum.description: The Comparator 0 interrupt is pending. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the flag.

BitField.name: CMP0_VLADEN
BitField.description: Voltage ladder enable for comparator 0.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The Comparator 0 voltage ladder is disabled.

Enum.name: DIS_DEEPSLP_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The Comparator 0 voltage ladder is disabled in Deep Sleep and Power-down modes and re-enabled automatically when exiting those modes.

Enum.name: DIS_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The Comparator 0 voltage ladder is disabled in Power-down mode and re-enabled automatically when exiting Power-down.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The Comparator 0 voltage ladder is enabled.

BitField.name: CMP0_VLADREF
BitField.description: Voltage reference select for comparator 0 voltage ladder.

BitField.name: CMP0_VSEL
BitField.description: Voltage ladder value for comparator 0. The reference voltage Vref depends on the setting of CMP0_VLADREF (either VDD(3V3) or voltage on pin VREF_CMP). 00000 = Vss. 00001 = 1 x Vref0 / 31. 00010 = 2 x Vref0 / 31. ... 11111 = Vref0

BitField.name: CMP1_EN
BitField.description: Comparator 1 enable control.

Enum.name: DIS_DEEPSLP_PWRDWN
Enum.description: Comparator 1 is disabled in Deep Sleep and Power-down modes and re-enabled automatically when exiting those modes.

Enum.name: DIS_PWRDWN
Enum.description: Comparator 1 is disabled in Power-down mode and re-enabled automatically when exiting Power-down.

BitField.name: CMP1_OE
BitField.description: Comparator 1 output enable.

BitField.name: CMP1_STAT
BitField.description: Comparator 1 status. This bit reflects the comparator 1 output, and is not affected by CMP1_OE.

BitField.name: CMP1_VM
BitField.description: Comparator 1 VM input select.

BitField.name: CMP1_VP
BitField.description: Comparator 1 VP input select.

BitField.name: CMP1_SYNC
BitField.description: Comparator 1 output synchronization control.

Enum.name: DIRECT
Enum.description: The comparator 1 output is used directly.

Enum.name: SYNCH
Enum.description: The comparator 1 output is synchronized with the internal bus clock for output to other peripherals.

BitField.name: CMP1_HYS
BitField.description: Comparator 1 hysteresis control. When enabled, hysteresis determines the difference required between the comparator inputs before the comparator output switches. The difference must be in the direction opposite of the current comparator output.

Enum.name: HYSTERESISOFF
Enum.description: Hysteresis is turned off, comparator output will change as the input voltages cross.

BitField.name: CMP1_INTPOL
BitField.description: Selects the polarity of the CMP1 output for purposes of generating level interrupts. See Table 412.

Enum.name: NOTINVERTED
Enum.description: The CMP1 output is used as-is for generating interrupts.

Enum.name: INVERTED
Enum.description: The CMP1 output is used inverted for generating interrupts.

BitField.name: CMP1_INTTYPE
BitField.description: Select comparator 1 interrupt type. See Table 412.

BitField.name: CMP1_INTEDGE
BitField.description: Select edge triggered interrupt to be active on either high or low transitions, when CMP1_IntType = 0. See Table 412.

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: Comparator 1 interrupt is active on falling edges.

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: Comparator 1 interrupt is active on rising edges.

Enum.name: DUALEDGE
Enum.description: Comparator 1 Interrupt is active on both edges.

BitField.name: CMP1_INTFLAG
BitField.description: Comparator 1 interrupt flag.

Enum.name: NOTPENDING
Enum.description: The Comparator 1 interrupt is not pending.

Enum.name: PENDING
Enum.description: The Comparator 1 interrupt is pending. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the flag.

BitField.name: CMP1_VLADEN
BitField.description: Voltage ladder enable for comparator 1.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The Comparator 1 voltage ladder is disabled.

Enum.name: DIS_DEEPSLP_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The Comparator 1 voltage ladder is disabled in Deep Sleep and Power-down modes and re-enabled automatically when exiting those modes.

Enum.name: DIS_PWRDWN
Enum.description: The Comparator 1 voltage ladder is disabled in Power-down mode and re-enabled automatically when exiting Power-down.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The Comparator 1 voltage ladder is enabled.

BitField.name: CMP1_VLADREF
BitField.description: Voltage reference select for comparator 1 voltage ladder.

BitField.name: CMP1_VSel
BitField.description: Voltage ladder value for comparator 1. The reference voltage Vref depends on the setting of CMP1_VLADREF (either VDD(3V3) or voltage on pin VREF_CMP). 00000 = Vss. 00001 = 1 x Vref1 / 31. 00010 = 2 x Vref1 / 31. ... 11111 = Vref1.

BitField.name: RTCCIF
BitField.description: When one, the Counter Increment Interrupt block generated an interrupt. Writing a one to this bit location clears the counter increment interrupt.

BitField.name: RTCALF
BitField.description: When one, the alarm registers generated an interrupt. Writing a one to this bit location clears the alarm interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CLKEN
BitField.description: Clock Enable.

Enum.name: THE_TIME_COUNTERS_AR
Enum.description: The time counters are disabled so that they may be initialized.

BitField.name: CTCRST
BitField.description: CTC Reset.

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: When one, the elements in the internal oscillator divider are reset, and remain reset until CCR[1] is changed to zero. This is the divider that generates the 1 Hz clock from the 32.768 kHz crystal. The state of the divider is not visible to software.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Internal test mode controls. These bits must be 0 for normal RTC operation.

BitField.name: CCALEN
BitField.description: Calibration counter enable.

Enum.name: THE_CALIBRATION_COUN
Enum.description: The calibration counter is disabled and reset to zero.

Enum.name: THE_CALIBRATION_COUN
Enum.description: The calibration counter is enabled and counting, using the 1 Hz clock. When the calibration counter is equal to the value of the CALIBRATION register, the counter resets and repeats counting up to the value of the CALIBRATION register. See Section 30.6.4.2 and Section 30.6.5.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: IMSEC
BitField.description: When 1, an increment of the Second value generates an interrupt.

BitField.name: IMMIN
BitField.description: When 1, an increment of the Minute value generates an interrupt.

BitField.name: IMHOUR
BitField.description: When 1, an increment of the Hour value generates an interrupt.

BitField.name: IMDOM
BitField.description: When 1, an increment of the Day of Month value generates an interrupt.

BitField.name: IMDOW
BitField.description: When 1, an increment of the Day of Week value generates an interrupt.

BitField.name: IMDOY
BitField.description: When 1, an increment of the Day of Year value generates an interrupt.

BitField.name: IMMON
BitField.description: When 1, an increment of the Month value generates an interrupt.

BitField.name: IMYEAR
BitField.description: When 1, an increment of the Year value generates an interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: AMRSEC
BitField.description: When 1, the Second value is not compared for the alarm.

BitField.name: AMRMIN
BitField.description: When 1, the Minutes value is not compared for the alarm.

BitField.name: AMRHOUR
BitField.description: When 1, the Hour value is not compared for the alarm.

BitField.name: AMRDOM
BitField.description: When 1, the Day of Month value is not compared for the alarm.

BitField.description: When 1, the Day of Week value is not compared for the alarm.

BitField.name: AMRDOY
BitField.description: When 1, the Day of Year value is not compared for the alarm.

BitField.name: AMRMON
BitField.description: When 1, the Month value is not compared for the alarm.

BitField.name: AMRYEAR
BitField.description: When 1, the Year value is not compared for the alarm.

BitField.name: CALVAL
BitField.description: If enabled, the calibration counter counts up to this value. The maximum value is 131, 072 corresponding to about 36.4 hours. Calibration is disabled if CALVAL = 0.

BitField.name: CALDIR
BitField.description: Calibration direction

Enum.name: BACKWARD_CALIBRATION
Enum.description: Backward calibration. When CALVAL is equal to the calibration counter, the RTC timers will stop incrementing for 1 second.

Enum.name: FORWARD_CALIBRATION_
Enum.description: Forward calibration. When CALVAL is equal to the calibration counter, the RTC timers will jump by 2 seconds.

BitField.name: RTC_OSCF
BitField.description: RTC Oscillator Fail detect flag. Read: this bit is set if the RTC oscillator stops, and when RTC power is first turned on. An interrupt will occur when this bit is set, the RTC_OSCFEN bit in RTC_AUXEN is a 1, and the RTC interrupt is enabled in the NVIC. Write: writing a 1 to this bit clears the flag.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTC_PDOUT
BitField.description: When 0: the RTC_ALARM pin reflects the RTC alarm status. When 1: the RTC_ALARM pin indicates Deep Power-down mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTC_OSCFEN
BitField.description: Oscillator Fail Detect interrupt enable. When 0: the RTC Oscillator Fail detect interrupt is disabled. When 1: the RTC Oscillator Fail detect interrupt is enabled. See Section 30.6.2.5.

Register.name: ERCONTROL
Register.description: Event Monitor/Recorder Control register. Contains bits that control actions for the event channels as well as for Event Monitor/Recorder setup.

BitField.name: INTWAKE_EN0
BitField.description: Interrupt and wakeup enable for channel 0.

Enum.name: NO_INTERRUPT_OR_WAKE
Enum.description: No interrupt or wakeup will be generated by event channel 0.

Enum.name: AN_EVENT_IN_CHANNEL_
Enum.description: An event in channel 0 will trigger an (RTC) interrupt and a wake-up request.

BitField.name: GPCLEAR_EN0
BitField.description: Enables automatically clearing the RTC general purpose registers when an event occurs on channel 0.

Enum.name: NOGPREG
Enum.description: Channel 0 has no influence on the general purpose registers.

Enum.name: CLRGPREG
Enum.description: An event in channel 0 will clear the general purpose registers asynchronously.

BitField.name: POL0
BitField.description: Selects the polarity of an event on input pin RTC_EV0.

Enum.name: NEG
Enum.description: A channel 0 event is defined as a negative edge on RTC_EV0.

Enum.name: POS
Enum.description: A channel 0 event is defined as a positive edge on RTC_EV0.

BitField.name: EV0_INPUT_EN
BitField.description: Event enable control for channel 0.[1]

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Event 0 input is disabled and forced high internally.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: INTWAKE_EN1
BitField.description: Interrupt and wakeup enable for channel 1.

Enum.name: NO_INTERRUPT_OR_WAKE
Enum.description: No interrupt or wakeup will be generated by event channel 1.

Enum.name: WAKEUP
Enum.description: An event in channel 1 will trigger an (RTC) interrupt and a wake-up request.

BitField.name: GPCLEAR_EN1
BitField.description: Enables automatically clearing the RTC general purpose registers when an event occurs on channel 1.

Enum.name: NOGPREG
Enum.description: Channel 1 has no influence on the general purpose registers.

Enum.name: CLRGPREG
Enum.description: A n event in channel 1 will clear the general purpose registers asynchronously.

BitField.name: POL1
BitField.description: Selects the polarity of an event on input pin RTC_EV1.

Enum.name: NEG
Enum.description: A channel 1 event is defined as a negative edge on RTC_EV1.

Enum.name: POS
Enum.description: A channel 1 event is defined as a positive edge on RTC_EV1.

BitField.name: EV1_INPUT_EN
BitField.description: Event enable control for channel 1.[1]

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Event 1 input is disabled and forced high internally.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: INTWAKE_EN2
BitField.description: Interrupt and wakeup enable for channel 2.

Enum.name: NO_INTERRUPT_OR_WAKE
Enum.description: No interrupt or wakeup will be generated by event channel 2.

Enum.name: WAKEUP
Enum.description: An event in channel 2 will trigger an (RTC) interrupt and a wake-up request.

BitField.name: GPCLEAR_EN2
BitField.description: Enables automatically clearing the RTC general purpose registers when an event occurs on channel 2.

Enum.name: NOGPREG
Enum.description: Channel 2 has no influence on the general purpose registers.

Enum.name: CLRGPREG
Enum.description: An event in channel 2 will clear the general purpose registers asynchronously.

BitField.name: POL2
BitField.description: Selects the polarity of an event on input pin RTC_EV2.

Enum.name: NEG
Enum.description: A channel 2 event is defined as a negative edge on RTC_EV2.

Enum.name: POS
Enum.description: A channel 2 event is defined as a positive edge on RTC_EV2.

BitField.name: EV2_INPUT_EN
BitField.description: Event enable control for channel 2.[1]

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Event 2 input is disabled and forced high internally.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ERMODE
BitField.description: Controls enabling the Event Monitor/Recorder and selecting its operating frequency.[2]

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Event Monitor/Recorder clocks are disabled. Operation of the Event Monitor/Recorder is disabled except for asynchronous clearing of GP registers if selected.

Enum.name: ENABLE_EVENT_MONITOR16HZ
Enum.description: Enable Event Monitor/Recorder and select a 16 Hz sample clock for event input edge detection and glitch suppression. Pulses (in either direction) shorter than 62.5 ms to 125 ms will be filtered out.

Enum.name: ENABLE_EVENT_MONITOR64HZ
Enum.description: Enable Event Monitor/Recorder and select a 64 Hz sample clock for event input edge detection and glitch suppression. Pulses (in either direction) shorter than 15.6 ms to 31.2 ms will be filtered out.

Enum.name: ENABLE_EVENT_MONITOR1KHZ
Enum.description: Enable Event Monitor/Recorder and select a 1 kHz sample clock for event input edge detection and glitch suppression. Pulses (in either direction) shorter than 1 ms to 2 ms will be filtered out.

Register.name: ERSTATUS
Register.description: Event Monitor/Recorder Status register. Contains status flags for event channels and other Event Monitor/Recorder conditions.

BitField.name: EV0
BitField.description: Event flag for channel 0 (RTC_EV0 pin). Set at the end of any second if there has been an event during the preceding second. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to it. Writing 0 has no effect.

Enum.name: AT_LEAST_ONE_EVENT_H
Enum.description: At least one event has occurred on channel 0.

BitField.name: EV1
BitField.description: Event flag for channel 1 (RTC_EV1 pin). Set at the end of any second if there has been an event during the preceding second. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to it. Writing 0 has no effect.

Enum.name: AT_LEAST_ONE_EVENT_H
Enum.description: At least one event has occurred on channel 1.

BitField.name: EV2
BitField.description: Event flag for channel 2 (RTC_EV2 pin). Set at the end of any second if there has been an event during the preceding second. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to it. Writing 0 has no effect.

Enum.name: AT_LEAST_ONE_EVENT_H
Enum.description: At least one event has occurred on channel 2.

BitField.name: GP_CLEARED
BitField.description: General purpose register asynchronous clear flag. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to it. Writing 0 has no effect.

Enum.name: NOGPCLR
Enum.description: General purpose registers have not been asynchronous cleared.

Enum.name: GPCLR
Enum.description: General purpose registers have been asynchronous cleared.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: WAKEUP
BitField.description: Interrupt/wakeup request flag (Read-only). This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to it. Writing 0 has no effect.

Register.name: ERCOUNTERS
Register.description: Event Monitor/Recorder Counters register. Allows reading the counters associated with the event channels.

BitField.name: COUNTER0
BitField.description: Value of the counter for event 0. If the counter reaches full count (the value 7), it remains there if additional events occur. This counter is cleared when the corresponding EVx bit in the ERSTATUS register is cleared by software.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: COUNTER1
BitField.description: Value of the counter for event 1. See description for COUNTER0.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: COUNTER2
BitField.description: Value of the counter for event 2. See description for COUNTER0.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: P0_0
Register.description: I/O configuration register for pin P0[0]

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P0[0]

Enum.name: I2C1_SDA
Enum.description: I2C1 data input/output (this pin does not use a specialized I2C pad).

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Selects function mode (on-chip pull-up/pull-down resistor control).

BitField.name: INV
BitField.description: Invert input

Enum.name: INPUT_NOT_INVERTED_
Enum.description: Input not inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 1, LOW on pin reads as 0).

Enum.name: INPUT_INVERTED_HIGH
Enum.description: Input inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 0, LOW on pin reads as 1).

BitField.name: SLEW
BitField.description: Driver slew rate

Enum.name: STANDARD
Enum.description: Standard mode, output slew rate control is enabled. More outputs can be switched simultaneously.

Enum.name: FAST
Enum.description: Fast mode, slew rate control is disabled. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

BitField.name: OD
BitField.description: Open-drain mode.

Enum.name: OPEN_DRAIN_MODE_ENAB
Enum.description: Open-drain mode enabled. This is not a true open-drain mode. Input cannot be pulled up above VDD.

Enum.name: USB_UP_LED2
Enum.description: USB port 2 GoodLink LED indicator. It is LOW when the device is configured (non-control endpoints enabled), or when the host is enabled and has detected a device on the bus. It is HIGH when the device is not configured, or when host is enabled and has not detected a device on the bus, or during global suspend. It transitions between LOW and HIGH (flashes) when the host is enabled and detects activity on the bus.

BitField.description: Configures I2C features for standard mode, fast mode, and Fast Mode Plus operation.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: I2C 50ns glitch filter and slew rate control enabled.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: I2C 50ns glitch filter and slew rate control disabled.

BitField.name: HIDRIVE
BitField.description: Controls sink current capability of the pin, only for P5[2] and P5[3].

Enum.name: LOWDRIVE
Enum.description: Output drive sink is 4 mA. This is sufficient for standard and fast mode I2C.

Enum.name: HIGHDRIVE
Enum.description: Output drive sink is 20 mA. This is needed for Fast Mode Plus I2C. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

Register.name: P0_29
Register.description: I/O configuration register for pin P0[29]

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P0[29]

Register.name: P0_30
Register.description: I/O configuration register for pin P0[30]

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P0[30]

Register.description: I/O configuration register for pin P0[31]

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P0[31]

Register.name: P1_0
Register.description: I/O configuration register for pin P1[0]

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P1[0]

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Selects function mode (on-chip pull-up/pull-down resistor control).

BitField.name: INV
BitField.description: Invert input

Enum.name: INPUT_NOT_INVERTED_
Enum.description: Input not inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 1, LOW on pin reads as 0).

Enum.name: INPUT_INVERTED_HIGH
Enum.description: Input inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 0, LOW on pin reads as 1).

BitField.name: SLEW
BitField.description: Driver slew rate

Enum.name: STANDARD
Enum.description: Standard mode, output slew rate control is enabled. More outputs can be switched simultaneously.

Enum.name: FAST
Enum.description: Fast mode, slew rate control is disabled. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

BitField.name: OD
BitField.description: Open-drain mode.

Enum.name: OPEN_DRAIN_MODE_ENAB
Enum.description: Open-drain mode enabled. This is not a true open-drain mode. Input cannot be pulled up above VDD.

Enum.name: USB_UP_LED1
Enum.description: It is LOW when the device is configured (non-control endpoints enabled), or when the host is enabled and has detected a device on the bus. It is HIGH when the device is not configured, or when host is enabled and has not detected a device on the bus, or during global suspend. It transitions between LOW and HIGH (flashes) when the host is enabled and detects activity on the bus.

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P2[11]

Enum.name: P2_11
Enum.description: General purpose digital input/output pin. This pin includes a 5 ns input glitch filter.

Enum.name: SD_DAT_1
Enum.description: Data line 1 for SD card interface.

Enum.name: I2S_TX_SCK
Enum.description: Transmit Clock. It is driven by the master and received by the slave. Corresponds to the signal SCK in the I2S-bus specification.

Register.name: P2_12
Register.description: I/O configuration register for pin P2[12]

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P2[12]

Enum.name: P2_12
Enum.description: General purpose digital input/output pin. This pin includes a 5 ns input glitch filter.

Enum.name: SD_DAT_2
Enum.description: Data line 2 for SD card interface.

Enum.name: I2S_TX_WS
Enum.description: Transmit Word Select. It is driven by the master and received by the slave. Corresponds to the signal WS in the I2S-bus specification.

Register.name: P2_13
Register.description: I/O configuration register for pin P2[13]

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P2[13]

Enum.name: P2_13
Enum.description: General purpose digital input/output pin. This pin includes a 5 ns input glitch filter.

Enum.name: SD_DAT_3
Enum.description: Data line 3 for SD card interface.

Enum.name: I2S_TX_SDA
Enum.description: Transmit data. It is driven by the transmitter and read by the receiver. Corresponds to the signal SD in the I2S-bus specification.

Register.name: P2_14
Register.description: I/O configuration register for pin P2[14]

BitField.name: FUNC
BitField.description: Selects pin function for pin P2[14]

Enum.name: I2C1_SDA
Enum.description: I2C1 data input/output (this pin does not use a specialized I2C pad).

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Selects function mode (on-chip pull-up/pull-down resistor control).

BitField.name: INV
BitField.description: Invert input

Enum.name: INPUT_NOT_INVERTED_
Enum.description: Input not inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 1, LOW on pin reads as 0).

Enum.name: INPUT_INVERTED_HIGH
Enum.description: Input inverted (HIGH on pin reads as 0, LOW on pin reads as 1).

BitField.name: SLEW
BitField.description: Driver slew rate

Enum.name: STANDARD
Enum.description: Standard mode, output slew rate control is enabled. More outputs can be switched simultaneously.

Enum.name: FAST
Enum.description: Fast mode, slew rate control is disabled. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

BitField.name: OD
BitField.description: Open-drain mode.

Enum.name: OPEN_DRAIN_MODE_ENAB
Enum.description: Open-drain mode enabled. This is not a true open-drain mode. Input cannot be pulled up above VDD.

BitField.name: HS
BitField.description: Configures I2C features for standard mode, fast mode, and Fast Mode Plus operation.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: I2C 50ns glitch filter and slew rate control enabled.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: I2C 50ns glitch filter and slew rate control disabled.

BitField.name: HIDRIVE
BitField.description: Controls sink current capability of the pin, only for P5[2] and P5[3].

Enum.name: LOWDRIVE
Enum.description: Output drive sink is 4 mA. This is sufficient for standard and fast mode I2C.

Enum.name: HIGHDRIVE
Enum.description: Output drive sink is 20 mA. This is needed for Fast Mode Plus I2C. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Control Register 0. Selects the serial clock rate, bus type, and data size.

BitField.name: DSS
BitField.description: Data Size Select. This field controls the number of bits transferred in each frame. Values 0000-0010 are not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: FRF
BitField.description: Frame Format.

Enum.name: THIS_COMBINATION_IS_
Enum.description: This combination is not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: CPOL
BitField.description: Clock Out Polarity. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: BUS_LOW
Enum.description: SSP controller maintains the bus clock low between frames.

Enum.name: BUS_HIGH
Enum.description: SSP controller maintains the bus clock high between frames.

BitField.name: CPHA
BitField.description: Clock Out Phase. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: FIRST_CLOCK
Enum.description: SSP controller captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition away from the inter-frame state of the clock line.

Enum.name: SECOND_CLOCK
Enum.description: SSP controller captures serial data on the second clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition back to the inter-frame state of the clock line.

BitField.name: SCR
BitField.description: Serial Clock Rate. The number of prescaler-output clocks per bit on the bus, minus one. Given that CPSDVSR is the prescale divider, and the APB clock PCLK clocks the prescaler, the bit frequency is PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Control Register 1. Selects master/slave and other modes.

BitField.name: LBM
BitField.description: Loop Back Mode.

Enum.name: OUPTU
Enum.description: Serial input is taken from the serial output (MOSI or MISO) rather than the serial input pin (MISO or MOSI respectively).

BitField.name: SSE
BitField.description: SSP Enable.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The SSP controller will interact with other devices on the serial bus. Software should write the appropriate control information to the other SSP registers and interrupt controller registers, before setting this bit.

BitField.name: MS
BitField.description: Master/Slave Mode.This bit can only be written when the SSE bit is 0.

Enum.name: MASTER
Enum.description: The SSP controller acts as a master on the bus, driving the SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines and receiving the MISO line.

Enum.name: SLAVE
Enum.description: The SSP controller acts as a slave on the bus, driving MISO line and receiving SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines.

BitField.name: SOD
BitField.description: Slave Output Disable. This bit is relevant only in slave mode (MS = 1). If it is 1, this blocks this SSP controller from driving the transmit data line (MISO).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DR
Register.description: Data Register. Writes fill the transmit FIFO, and reads empty the receive FIFO.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Write: software can write data to be sent in a future frame to this register whenever the TNF bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Tx FIFO is not full. If the Tx FIFO was previously empty and the SSP controller is not busy on the bus, transmission of the data will begin immediately. Otherwise the data written to this register will be sent as soon as all previous data has been sent (and received). If the data length is less than 16 bits, software must right-justify the data written to this register. Read: software can read data from this register whenever the RNE bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Rx FIFO is not empty. When software reads this register, the SSP controller returns data from the least recent frame in the Rx FIFO. If the data length is less than 16 bits, the data is right-justified in this field with higher order bits filled with 0s.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This bit is 1 is the Transmit FIFO is empty, 0 if not.

BitField.name: TNF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full. This bit is 0 if the Tx FIFO is full, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RNE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Not Empty. This bit is 0 if the Receive FIFO is empty, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RFF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full. This bit is 1 if the Receive FIFO is full, 0 if not.

BitField.name: BSY
BitField.description: Busy. This bit is 0 if the SSPn controller is idle, or 1 if it is currently sending/receiving a frame and/or the Tx FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: CPSDVSR
BitField.description: This even value between 2 and 254, by which PCLK is divided to yield the prescaler output clock. Bit 0 always reads as 0.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IMSC
Register.description: Interrupt Mask Set and Clear Register

BitField.name: RORIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Overrun occurs, that is, when the Rx FIFO is full and another frame is completely received. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Time-out condition occurs. A Receive Time-out occurs when the Rx FIFO is not empty, and no has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, and has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RTMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, has not been read for a time-out period, and this interrupt is enabled. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: TXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the frame was received when RxFIFO was full interrupt.

BitField.name: RTIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the Rx FIFO was not empty and has not been read for a time-out period interrupt. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR / [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RXDMAE
BitField.description: Receive DMA Enable. When this bit is set to one 1, DMA for the receive FIFO is enabled, otherwise receive DMA is disabled.

BitField.name: TXDMAE
BitField.description: Transmit DMA Enable. When this bit is set to one 1, DMA for the transmit FIFO is enabled, otherwise transmit DMA is disabled

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR
Register.description: A/D Control Register. The ADCR register must be written to select the operating mode before A/D conversion can occur.

BitField.name: SEL
BitField.description: Selects which of the AD0[7:0] pins is (are) to be sampled and converted. For AD0, bit 0 selects Pin AD0[0], and bit 7 selects pin AD0[7]. In software-controlled mode, only one of these bits should be 1. In hardware scan mode, any value containing 1 to 8 ones is allowed. All zeroes is equivalent to 0x01.

BitField.name: CLKDIV
BitField.description: The APB clock (PCLK) is divided by (this value plus one) to produce the clock for the A/D converter, which should be less than or equal to 12.4 MHz. Typically, software should program the smallest value in this field that yields a clock of 12.4 MHz or slightly less, but in certain cases (such as a high-impedance analog source) a slower clock may be desirable.

BitField.name: BURST
BitField.description: Burst mode

Enum.name: BURST
Enum.description: The AD converter does repeated conversions at up to 400 kHz, scanning (if necessary) through the pins selected by bits set to ones in the SEL field. The first conversion after the start corresponds to the least-significant 1 in the SEL field, then higher numbered 1-bits (pins) if applicable. Repeated conversions can be terminated by clearing this bit, but the conversion that's in progress when this bit is cleared will be completed. START bits must be 000 when BURST = 1 or conversions will not start.

Enum.name: SW
Enum.description: Conversions are software controlled and require 31 clocks.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PDN
BitField.description: Power down mode

Enum.name: POWERDOWN
Enum.description: The A/D converter is in power-down mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: When the BURST bit is 0, these bits control whether and when an A/D conversion is started:

Enum.name: NO_START_THIS_VALUE
Enum.description: No start (this value should be used when clearing PDN to 0).

Enum.name: P2_10
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on the P2[10] pin.

Enum.name: P1_27
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on the P1[27] pin.

Enum.name: MAT0_1
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on MAT0.1. Note that this does not require that the MAT0.1 function appear on a device pin.

Enum.name: MAT0_3
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on MAT0.3. Note that it is not possible to cause the MAT0.3 function to appear on a device pin.

Enum.name: MAT1_0
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on MAT1.0. Note that this does not require that the MAT1.0 function appear on a device pin.

Enum.name: MAT1_1
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on MAT1.1. Note that this does not require that the MAT1.1 function appear on a device pin.

BitField.name: EDGE
BitField.description: This bit is significant only when the START field contains 010-111. In these cases:

Enum.name: FALLLING
Enum.description: Start conversion on a falling edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: Start conversion on a rising edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: GDR
Register.description: A/D Global Data Register. This register contains the ADC's DONE bit and the result of the most recent A/D conversion.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESULT
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the AD0[n] pin selected by the SEL field, as it falls within the range of VREFP to VSS. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the input pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on the input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CHN
BitField.description: These bits contain the channel from which the RESULT bits were converted (e.g. 000 identifies channel 0, 001 channel 1...).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the RESULT bits. This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read and when the ADCR is written. If the ADCR is written while a conversion is still in progress, this bit is set and a new conversion is started.

Register.name: INTEN
Register.description: A/D Interrupt Enable Register. This register contains enable bits that allow the DONE flag of each A/D channel to be included or excluded from contributing to the generation of an A/D interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN0
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 0 will not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 0 will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN1
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 1 will not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 1 will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN2
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 2 will not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 2 will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN3
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 3 will not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 3 will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN4
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 4 will not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 4 will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN5
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 5 will not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 5 will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN6
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 6 will not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 6 will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTEN7
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 7 will not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Completion of a conversion on ADC channel 7 will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: ADGINTEN
BitField.description: Interrupt enable

Enum.name: CHANNELS
Enum.description: Only the individual ADC channels enabled by ADINTEN7:0 will generate interrupts.

Enum.name: GLOBAL
Enum.description: The global DONE flag in ADDR is enabled to generate an interrupt in addition to any individual ADC channels that are enabled to generate interrupts.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: DR[0]
Register.description: A/D Channel 0 Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel 0.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESULT
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the AD0[n] pin, as it falls within the range of VREFP to V SS. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the input pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VSS, while 0xFFF indicates that the voltage on the input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREFP.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the RESULT bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.description: A/D Channel 0 Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel 0.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: A/D Status Register. This register contains DONE and OVERRUN flags for all of the A/D channels, as well as the A/D interrupt/DMA flag.

BitField.name: DONE0
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the DONE status flag from the result register for A/D channel 0.

BitField.name: DONE1
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the DONE status flag from the result register for A/D channel 1.

BitField.name: DONE2
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the DONE status flag from the result register for A/D channel 2.

BitField.name: DONE3
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the DONE status flag from the result register for A/D channel 3.

BitField.name: DONE4
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the DONE status flag from the result register for A/D channel 4.

BitField.name: DONE5
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the DONE status flag from the result register for A/D channel 5.

BitField.name: DONE6
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the DONE status flag from the result register for A/D channel 6.

BitField.name: DONE7
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the DONE status flag from the result register for A/D channel 7.

BitField.name: OVERRUN0
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the OVERRRUN status flag from the result register for A/D channel 0.

BitField.name: OVERRUN1
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the OVERRRUN status flag from the result register for A/D channel 1.

BitField.name: OVERRUN2
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the OVERRRUN status flag from the result register for A/D channel 2.

BitField.name: OVERRUN3
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the OVERRRUN status flag from the result register for A/D channel 3.

BitField.name: OVERRUN4
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the OVERRRUN status flag from the result register for A/D channel 4.

BitField.name: OVERRUN5
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the OVERRRUN status flag from the result register for A/D channel 5.

BitField.name: OVERRUN6
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the OVERRRUN status flag from the result register for A/D channel 6.

BitField.name: OVERRUN7
BitField.description: This bit mirrors the OVERRRUN status flag from the result register for A/D channel 7.

BitField.name: ADINT
BitField.description: This bit is the A/D interrupt flag. It is one when any of the individual A/D channel Done flags is asserted and enabled to contribute to the A/D interrupt via the ADINTEN register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ADCOFFS
BitField.description: Offset trim bits for ADC operation. Initialized by the boot code. Can be overwritten by the user.

BitField.name: TRIM
BitField.description: written-to by boot code. Can not be overwritten by the user. These bits are locked after boot code write.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ACCOFF
BitField.description: if AccBP is 0, the Acceptance Filter is not operational. All Rx messages on all CAN buses are ignored.

BitField.name: ACCBP
BitField.description: All Rx messages are accepted on enabled CAN controllers. Software must set this bit before modifying the contents of any of the registers described below, and before modifying the contents of Lookup Table RAM in any way other than setting or clearing Disable bits in Standard Identifier entries. When both this bit and AccOff are 0, the Acceptance filter operates to screen received CAN Identifiers.

BitField.name: EFCAN
BitField.description: FullCAN mode

Enum.name: SOFTWARE_MUST_READ_A
Enum.description: Software must read all messages for all enabled IDs on all enabled CAN buses, from the receiving CAN controllers.

Enum.name: THE_ACCEPTANCE_FILTE
Enum.description: The Acceptance Filter itself will take care of receiving and storing messages for selected Standard ID values on selected CAN buses. See Section 21.16 FullCAN mode on page 576.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: SFF_SA
Register.description: Standard Frame Individual Start Address Register

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: SFF_SA
BitField.description: The start address of the table of individual Standard Identifiers in AF Lookup RAM. If the table is empty, write the same value in this register and the SFF_GRP_sa register described below. For compatibility with possible future devices, write zeroes in bits 31:11 and 1:0 of this register. If the eFCAN bit in the AFMR is 1, this value also indicates the size of the table of Standard IDs which the Acceptance Filter will search and (if found) automatically store received messages in Acceptance Filter RAM.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: SFF_GRP_SA
Register.description: Standard Frame Group Start Address Register

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: SFF_GRP_SA
BitField.description: The start address of the table of grouped Standard Identifiers in AF Lookup RAM. If the table is empty, write the same value in this register and the EFF_sa register described below. The largest value that should be written to this register is 0x800, when only the Standard Individual table is used, and the last word (address 0x7FC) in AF Lookup Table RAM is used. For compatibility with possible future devices, please write zeroes in bits 31:12 and 1:0 of this register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EFF_SA
BitField.description: The start address of the table of individual Extended Identifiers in AF Lookup RAM. If the table is empty, write the same value in this register and the EFF_GRP_sa register described below. The largest value that should be written to this register is 0x800, when both Extended Tables are empty and the last word (address 0x7FC) in AF Lookup Table RAM is used. For compatibility with possible future devices, please write zeroes in bits 31:11 and 1:0 of this register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: EFF_GRP_SA
Register.description: Extended Frame Group Start Address Register

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EFF_GRP_SA
BitField.description: The start address of the table of grouped Extended Identifiers in AF Lookup RAM. If the table is empty, write the same value in this register and the ENDofTable register described below. The largest value that should be written to this register is 0x800, when this table is empty and the last word (address 0x7FC) in AF Lookup Table RAM is used. For compatibility with possible future devices, please write zeroes in bits 31:12 and 1:0 of this register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ENDOFTABLE
BitField.description: The address above the last active address in the last active AF table. For compatibility with possible future devices, please write zeroes in bits 31:12 and 1:0 of this register. If the eFCAN bit in the AFMR is 0, the largest value that should be written to this register is 0x800, which allows the last word (address 0x7FC) in AF Lookup Table RAM to be used. If the eFCAN bit in the AFMR is 1, this value marks the start of the area of Acceptance Filter RAM, into which the Acceptance Filter will automatically receive messages for selected IDs on selected CAN buses. In this case, the maximum value that should be written to this register is 0x800 minus 6 times the value in SFF_sa. This allows 12 bytes of message storage between this address and the end of Acceptance Filter RAM, for each Standard ID that is specified between the start of Acceptance Filter RAM, and the next active AF table.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: LUTERRAD
BitField.description: It the LUT Error bit (below) is 1, this read-only field contains the address in AF Lookup Table RAM, at which the Acceptance Filter encountered an error in the content of the tables.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: LUTERR
BitField.description: This read-only bit is set to 1 if the Acceptance Filter encounters an error in the content of the tables in AF RAM. It is cleared when software reads the LUTerrAd register. This condition is ORed with the other CAN interrupts from the CAN controllers, to produce the request that is connected to the NVIC.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: FCANIE
BitField.description: Global FullCAN Interrupt Enable. When 1, this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: INTPND
BitField.description: FullCan Interrupt Pending 0 = FullCan Interrupt Pending bit 0. 1 = FullCan Interrupt Pending bit 1. ... 31 = FullCan Interrupt Pending bit 31.

BitField.name: IntPnd32
BitField.description: FullCan Interrupt Pending bit 32. 0 = FullCan Interrupt Pending bit 32. 1 = FullCan Interrupt Pending bit 33. ... 31 = FullCan Interrupt Pending bit 63.

BitField.name: TS1
BitField.description: When 1, the CAN controller 1 is sending a message (same as TS in the CAN1GSR).

BitField.name: TS2
BitField.description: When 1, the CAN controller 2 is sending a message (same as TS in the CAN2GSR)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TBS1
BitField.description: When 1, all 3 Tx Buffers of the CAN1 controller are available to the CPU (same as TBS in CAN1GSR).

BitField.name: TBS2
BitField.description: When 1, all 3 Tx Buffers of the CAN2 controller are available to the CPU (same as TBS in CAN2GSR).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TCS1
BitField.description: When 1, all requested transmissions have been completed successfully by the CAN1 controller (same as TCS in CAN1GSR).

BitField.name: TCS2
BitField.description: When 1, all requested transmissions have been completed successfully by the CAN2 controller (same as TCS in CAN2GSR).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RS1
BitField.description: When 1, CAN1 is receiving a message (same as RS in CAN1GSR).

BitField.name: RS2
BitField.description: When 1, CAN2 is receiving a message (same as RS in CAN2GSR).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RB1
BitField.description: When 1, a received message is available in the CAN1 controller (same as RBS in CAN1GSR).

BitField.name: RB2
BitField.description: When 1, a received message is available in the CAN2 controller (same as RBS in CAN2GSR).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: DOS1
BitField.description: When 1, a message was lost because the preceding message to CAN1 controller was not read out quickly enough (same as DOS in CAN1GSR).

BitField.name: DOS2
BitField.description: When 1, a message was lost because the preceding message to CAN2 controller was not read out quickly enough (same as DOS in CAN2GSR).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: E1
BitField.description: When 1, one or both of the CAN1 Tx and Rx Error Counters has reached the limit set in the CAN1EWL register (same as ES in CAN1GSR)

BitField.name: E2
BitField.description: When 1, one or both of the CAN2 Tx and Rx Error Counters has reached the limit set in the CAN2EWL register (same as ES in CAN2GSR)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: BS1
BitField.description: When 1, the CAN1 controller is currently involved in bus activities (same as BS in CAN1GSR).

BitField.name: BS2
BitField.description: When 1, the CAN2 controller is currently involved in bus activities (same as BS in CAN2GSR).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MOD
Register.description: Controls the operating mode of the CAN Controller.

BitField.name: RM
BitField.description: Reset Mode.

Enum.name: NORMAL_THE_CAN_CONTR
Enum.description: Normal.The CAN Controller is in the Operating Mode, and certain registers can not be written.

Enum.name: RESET_CAN_OPERATION
Enum.description: Reset. CAN operation is disabled, writable registers can be written and the current transmission/reception of a message is aborted.

BitField.name: LOM
BitField.description: Listen Only Mode.

Enum.name: NORMAL_THE_CAN_CONT
Enum.description: Normal. The CAN controller acknowledges a successfully received message on the CAN bus. The error counters are stopped at the current value.

Enum.name: LISTEN_ONLY_THE_CON
Enum.description: Listen only. The controller gives no acknowledgment, even if a message is successfully received. Messages cannot be sent, and the controller operates in error passive mode. This mode is intended for software bit rate detection and hot plugging.

BitField.name: STM
BitField.description: Self Test Mode.

Enum.name: NORMAL_A_TRANSMITTE
Enum.description: Normal. A transmitted message must be acknowledged to be considered successful.

Enum.name: SELF_TEST_THE_CONTR
Enum.description: Self test. The controller will consider a Tx message successful even if there is no acknowledgment received. In this mode a full node test is possible without any other active node on the bus using the SRR bit in CANxCMR.

BitField.name: TPM
BitField.description: Transmit Priority Mode.

Enum.name: CAN_ID_THE_TRANSMIT
Enum.description: CAN ID. The transmit priority for 3 Transmit Buffers depends on the CAN Identifier.

Enum.name: LOCAL_PRIORITY_THE_
Enum.description: Local priority. The transmit priority for 3 Transmit Buffers depends on the contents of the Tx Priority register within the Transmit Buffer.

BitField.name: SM
BitField.description: Sleep Mode.

Enum.name: SLEEP_THE_CAN_CONTR
Enum.description: Sleep. The CAN controller enters Sleep Mode if no CAN interrupt is pending and there is no bus activity. See the Sleep Mode description Section 21.8.2 on page 565.

BitField.name: RPM
BitField.description: Receive Polarity Mode.

Enum.name: LOW_ACTIVE_RD_INPUT
Enum.description: Low active. RD input is active Low (dominant bit = 0).

Enum.name: HIGH_ACTIVE_RD_INPU
Enum.description: High active. RD input is active High (dominant bit = 1) -- reverse polarity.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TM
BitField.description: Test Mode.

Enum.name: ENABLED_THE_TD_PIN_
Enum.description: Enabled. The TD pin will reflect the bit, detected on RD pin, with the next positive edge of the system clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CMR
Register.description: Command bits that affect the state of the CAN Controller

BitField.name: TR
BitField.description: Transmission Request.

Enum.name: PRESENT_THE_MESSAGE
Enum.description: Present. The message, previously written to the CANxTFI, CANxTID, and optionally the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers, is queued for transmission from the selected Transmit Buffer.
