BitField.name: ABEOINTCLR
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: ABTOINTCLR
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: FDR
Register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

BitField.name: DIVADDVAL
BitField.description: Baud-rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud-rate generator will not impact the UARTn baudrate.

BitField.name: MULVAL
BitField.description: Baud-rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UARTn to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud-rate generator is used or not.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TER
Register.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off UART transmitter for use with software flow control.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TXEN
BitField.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit is cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software implementing software-handshaking can clear this bit when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RS485CTRL
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

BitField.name: NMMEN
BitField.description: NMM enable.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte has the parity bit = 1, generating a received data interrupt. See Section 18.6.16 RS-485/EIA-485 modes of operation.

BitField.name: RXDIS
BitField.description: Receiver enable.

BitField.name: AADEN
BitField.description: AAD enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DCTRL
BitField.description: Direction control enable.

BitField.name: OINV
BitField.description: Direction control pin polarity. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the Un_OE pin.

Enum.name: DIRLOW
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

Enum.name: DIRHIGH
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

BitField.name: ADRMATCH
BitField.description: Contains the address match value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLY
BitField.description: Contains the direction control (UnOE) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CONSET
Register.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AA
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge flag.

BitField.name: SI
BitField.description: I2C interrupt flag.

BitField.name: STO
BitField.description: STOP flag.

BitField.name: STA
BitField.description: START flag.

BitField.name: I2EN
BitField.description: I2C interface enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: These bits are unused and are always 0.

BitField.name: Status
BitField.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I 2C interface.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAT
Register.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR0
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLH
Register.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLL
Register.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. SCLL and SCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: Count for SCL low time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CONCLR
Register.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AAC
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge Clear bit.

BitField.name: SIC
BitField.description: I2C interrupt Clear bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: STAC
BitField.description: START flag Clear bit.

BitField.name: I2ENC
BitField.description: I2C interface Disable bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MM_ENA
BitField.description: Monitor mode enable.

Enum.name: THE_I_2C_MODULE_WILL
Enum.description: The I 2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

BitField.name: ENA_SCL
BitField.description: SCL output enable.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET
Enum.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

BitField.name: MATCH_ALL
BitField.description: Select interrupt register match.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above. That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET
Enum.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

Register.name: ADR1
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR2
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR3
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DATA_BUFFER
Register.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RBR
Register.description: Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read (DLAB =0).

BitField.name: RBR
BitField.description: The UART4 Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the UART4 Rx FIFO.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: THR
Register.description: Transmit Holding Register. The next character to be transmitted is written here (DLAB =0).

BitField.name: THR
BitField.description: Writing to the UART4 Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the UART4 transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it reaches the bottom of the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: DLL
Register.description: Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider (DLAB =1).

BitField.name: DLLSB
BitField.description: The UART4 Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the U4DLM register, determines the baud rate of the UART4.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: DLM
Register.description: Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider (DLAB =1).

BitField.name: DLMSB
BitField.description: The UART4 Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the U0DLL register, determines the baud rate of the UART4.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IER
Register.description: Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential UART interrupts (DLAB =0).

BitField.name: RBRIE
BitField.description: RBR Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt for UARTn. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: THREIE
BitField.description: THRE Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt for UARTn. The status of this can be read from UnLSR[5].

BitField.name: RXIE
BitField.description: RX Line Status Interrupt Enable. Enables the UARTn RX line status interrupts. The status of this interrupt can be read from UnLSR[4:1].

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_RX_LINE_
Enum.description: Disable the RX line status interrupts.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_RX_LINE_S
Enum.description: Enable the RX line status interrupts.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ABEOINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

BitField.name: ABTOINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the auto-baud time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: IIR
Register.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

BitField.name: INTSTATUS
BitField.description: Interrupt status. Note that U4IIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating U4IIR[3:1].

Enum.name: AT_LEAST_ONE_INTERRU
Enum.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

BitField.name: INTID
BitField.description: Interrupt identification. U4IER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the UART4 Rx or TX FIFO. All other combinations of U4IER[3:1] not listed below are reserved (000,100,101,111).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: FIFOENABLE
BitField.description: Copies of U4FCR[0].

BitField.name: ABEOINT
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: ABTOINT
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: FCR
Register.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls UART FIFO usage and modes.

BitField.name: FIFOEN
BitField.description: FIFO Enable.

Enum.name: UARTN_FIFOS_ARE_DISA
Enum.description: UARTn FIFOs are disabled. Must not be used in the application.

Enum.name: ACTIVE_HIGH_ENABLE_F
Enum.description: Active high enable for both UARTn Rx and TX FIFOs and UnFCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper UART operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the related UART FIFOs.

BitField.name: RXFIFORES
BitField.description: RX FIFO Reset.

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_
Enum.description: No impact on either of UARTn FIFOs.

Enum.name: WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to UnFCR[1] will clear all bytes in UARTn Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: TXFIFORES
BitField.description: TX FIFO Reset.

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_
Enum.description: No impact on either of UARTn FIFOs.

Enum.name: WRITING_A_LOGIC_1_TO
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to UnFCR[2] will clear all bytes in UARTn TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: DMAMODE
BitField.description: DMA Mode Select. When the FIFO enable (bit 0 of this register) is set, this bit selects the DMA mode. See Section 20.6.6.1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RXTRIGLVL
BitField.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver UARTn FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt or DMA request is activated.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: LCR
Register.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

BitField.name: WLS
BitField.description: Word Length Select.

BitField.name: SBS
BitField.description: Stop Bit Select

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Enable.

BitField.name: PS
BitField.description: Parity Select

Enum.name: ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O
Enum.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

Enum.name: EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_
Enum.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

BitField.name: BC
BitField.description: Break Control

Enum.name: ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI
Enum.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin UARTn TXD is forced to logic 0 when UnLCR[6] is active high.

BitField.name: DLAB
BitField.description: Divisor Latch Access Bit

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: LSR
Register.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

BitField.name: RDR
BitField.description: Receiver Data Ready. UnLSR[0] is set when the UnRBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the UARTn RBR FIFO is empty.

Enum.name: THE_UARTN_RECEIVER_F
Enum.description: The UARTn receiver FIFO is empty.

Enum.name: THE_UARTN_RECEIVER_F
Enum.description: The UARTn receiver FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: OE
BitField.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[1]. UnLSR[1] is set when UARTn RSR has a new character assembled and the UARTn RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the UARTn RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the UARTn RSR will be lost.

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: FE
BitField.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. An UnLSR read clears UnLSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Upon detection of a framing error, the Rx will attempt to resynchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: BI
BitField.description: Break Interrupt. When RXDn is held in the spacing state (all zeroes) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXDn goes to marking state (all ones). An UnLSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on UnFCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the UARTn RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: THRE
BitField.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty. THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty UARTn THR and is cleared on a UnTHR write.

BitField.name: TEMT
BitField.description: Transmitter Empty. TEMT is set when both UnTHR and UnTSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the UnTSR or the UnTHR contain valid data.

Enum.name: VALID_DATA
Enum.description: UnTHR and/or the UnTSR contains valid data.

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: UnTHR and the UnTSR are empty.

BitField.name: RXFE
BitField.description: Error in RX FIFO . UnLSR[7] is set when a character with a Rx error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the UnRBR. This bit is cleared when the UnLSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the UARTn FIFO.

Enum.name: UNRBR_CONTAINS_NO_UA
Enum.description: UnRBR contains no UARTn RX errors or UnFCR[0]=0.

Enum.name: UARTN_RBR_CONTAINS_A
Enum.description: UARTn RBR contains at least one UARTn RX error.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCR
Register.description: Scratch Pad Register. 8-bit temporary storage for software.

BitField.name: Pad
BitField.description: A readable, writable byte.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: ACR
Register.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

Enum.name: AUTO_BAUD_START_AUT
Enum.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Auto-baud mode select bit.

BitField.name: AUTORESTART
BitField.description: Restart bit.

Enum.name: RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T
Enum.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next UARTn Rx falling edge)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ABEOINTCLR
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: ABTOINTCLR
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: ICR
Register.description: IrDA Control Register. Enables and configures the IrDA mode.

BitField.name: IRDAEN
BitField.description: IrDA mode

Enum.name: DISABLED_IRDA_MODE_
Enum.description: Disabled. IrDA mode on UART4 is disabled, UART4 acts as a standard UART.

Enum.name: ENABLED_IRDA_MODE_O
Enum.description: Enabled. IrDA mode on UART4 is enabled.

BitField.name: IRDAINV
BitField.description: Serial input direction.

Enum.name: INVERTED_THIS_HAS_N
Enum.description: Inverted. This has no effect on the serial output.

BitField.name: FIXPULSEEN
BitField.description: IrDA fixed pulse width mode.

BitField.name: PULSEDIV
BitField.description: Configures the pulse when FixPulseEn = 1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: FDR
Register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

BitField.name: DIVADDVAL
BitField.description: Baud Rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud rate generator will not impact the UART4 baud rate.

BitField.name: MULVAL
BitField.description: Baud Rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UART4 to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud rate generator is used or not.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: OSR
Register.description: Oversampling register. Controls the degree of oversampling during each bit time.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: OSFRAC
BitField.description: Fractional part of the oversampling ratio, in units of 1/8th of an input clock period. (001 = 0.125, ..., 111 = 0.875)

BitField.name: OSINT
BitField.description: Integer part of the oversampling ratio, minus 1. The reset values equate to the normal operating mode of 16 input clocks per bit time.

BitField.name: FDINT
BitField.description: In smartcard mode, these bits act as a more-significant extension of the OSint field, allowing an oversampling ratio up to 2048 as required by ISO7816-3. In smartcard mode, bits 14:4 should initially be set to 371, yielding an oversampling ratio of 372.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: SCICTRL
Register.description: Smart Card Interface control register. Enables and configures the smartcard Interface feature.

BitField.name: SCIEN
BitField.description: Smart Card Interface Enable.

Enum.name: ASYNCHRONOUS_HALF_DU
Enum.description: Asynchronous half duplex smart card interface is enabled.

BitField.name: NACKDIS
BitField.description: NACK response disable. Only applicable in T=0.

BitField.name: PROTSEL
BitField.description: Protocol selection as defined in the ISO7816-3 standard.

BitField.name: TXRETRY
BitField.description: Maximum number of retransmissions in case of a negative acknowledge (protocol T=0). When the retry counter is exceeded, the USART will be locked until the FIFO is cleared. A TX error interrupt is generated when enabled.

BitField.name: GUARDTIME
BitField.description: Extra guard time. No extra guard time (0x0) results in a standard guard time as defined in ISO 7816-3, depending on the protocol type. A guard time of 0xFF indicates a minimal guard time as defined for the selected protocol.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RS485CTRL
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

BitField.name: NMMEN
BitField.description: NMM enable.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte causes the USART to set the parity error and generate an interrupt. See Section 20.6.18 RS-485/EIA-485 modes of operation.

BitField.name: RXDIS
BitField.description: Receiver enable.

BitField.name: AADEN
BitField.description: AAD enable

BitField.name: DCTRL
BitField.description: Direction control for DIR pin.

BitField.name: OINV
BitField.description: Direction control pin polarity. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the DIR pin.

Enum.name: LOW_THE_DIRECTION_C
Enum.description: Low. The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

Enum.name: HIGH_THE_DIRECTION_
Enum.description: High. The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

BitField.name: ADRMATCH
BitField.description: Contains the address match value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLY
BitField.description: Contains the direction control (U4OE) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: SYNC
BitField.description: Enables synchronous mode.

BitField.name: CSRC
BitField.description: Clock source select.

BitField.name: FES
BitField.description: Falling edge sampling.

Enum.name: RXD_IS_SAMPLED_ON_TH
Enum.description: RxD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK

Enum.name: RXD_IS_SAMPLED_ON_TH
Enum.description: RxD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK

BitField.name: TSBYPASS
BitField.description: Transmit synchronization bypass in synchronous slave mode.

Enum.name: THE_INPUT_CLOCK_IS_S
Enum.description: The input clock is synchronized prior to being used in clock edge detection logic.

Enum.name: THE_INPUT_CLOCK_IS_N
Enum.description: The input clock is not synchronized prior to being used in clock edge detection logic. This allows for a high er input clock rate at the expense of potential metastability.

BitField.name: CSCEN
BitField.description: Continuous master clock enable (used only when CSRC is 1)

Enum.name: SCLK_CYCLES_ONLY_WHE
Enum.description: SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on TxD

Enum.name: SCLK_RUNS_CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: SCLK runs continuously (characters can be received on RxD independently from transmission on TxD)

BitField.name: SSSDIS
BitField.description: Start/stop bits

Enum.name: SEND_START_AND_STOP_
Enum.description: Send start and stop bits as in other modes.

BitField.name: CCCLR
BitField.description: Continuous clock clear

Enum.name: HARDWARE_CLEARS_CSCE
Enum.description: Hardware clears CSCEN after each character is received.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAO
Register.description: I2S Digital Audio Output Register. Contains control bits for the I2S transmit channel.

BitField.name: WORDWIDTH
BitField.description: Selects the number of bytes in data as follows:

BitField.name: MONO
BitField.description: When 1, data is of monaural format. When 0, the data is in stereo format.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: When 1, disables accesses on FIFOs, places the transmit channel in mute mode.

BitField.name: RESET
BitField.description: When 1, asynchronously resets the transmit channel and FIFO.

BitField.name: WS_SEL
BitField.description: When 0, the interface is in master mode. When 1, the interface is in slave mode. See Section 34.7.2 for a summary of useful combinations for this bit with TXMODE.

BitField.name: WS_HALFPERIOD
BitField.description: Word select half period minus 1, i.e. WS 64clk period -> ws_halfperiod = 31.

BitField.name: MUTE
BitField.description: When 1, the transmit channel sends only zeroes.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAI
Register.description: I2S Digital Audio Input Register. Contains control bits for the I2S receive channel.

BitField.name: WORDWIDTH
BitField.description: Selects the number of bytes in data as follows:

BitField.name: MONO
BitField.description: When 1, data is of monaural format. When 0, the data is in stereo format.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: When 1, disables accesses on FIFOs, places the transmit channel in mute mode.

BitField.name: RESET
BitField.description: When 1, asynchronously reset the transmit channel and FIFO.

BitField.name: WS_SEL
BitField.description: When 0, the interface is in master mode. When 1, the interface is in slave mode. See Section 34.7.2 for a summary of useful combinations for this bit with RXMODE.

BitField.name: WS_HALFPERIOD
BitField.description: Word select half period minus 1, i.e. WS 64clk period -> ws_halfperiod = 31.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TXFIFO
Register.description: I2S Transmit FIFO. Access register for the 8 x 32-bit transmitter FIFO.

BitField.name: I2STXFIFO
BitField.description: 8 x 32-bit transmit FIFO.

Register.name: RXFIFO
Register.description: I2S Receive FIFO. Access register for the 8 x 32-bit receiver FIFO.

BitField.name: I2SRXFIFO
BitField.description: 8 x 32-bit transmit FIFO.

Register.name: STATE
Register.description: I2S Status Feedback Register. Contains status information about the I2S interface.

BitField.name: IRQ
BitField.description: This bit reflects the presence of Receive Interrupt or Transmit Interrupt. This is determined by comparing the current FIFO levels to the rx_depth_irq and tx_depth_irq fields in the IRQ register.

BitField.name: DMAREQ1
BitField.description: This bit reflects the presence of Receive or Transmit DMA Request 1. This is determined by comparing the current FIFO levels to the rx_depth_dma1 and tx_depth_dma1 fields in the DMA1 register.

BitField.name: DMAREQ2
BitField.description: This bit reflects the presence of Receive or Transmit DMA Request 2. This is determined by comparing the current FIFO levels to the rx_depth_dma2 and tx_depth_dma2 fields in the DMA2 register.

BitField.name: RX_LEVEL
BitField.description: Reflects the current level of the Receive FIFO.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_LEVEL
BitField.description: Reflects the current level of the Transmit FIFO.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DMA1
Register.description: I2S DMA Configuration Register 1. Contains control information for DMA request 1.

BitField.name: RX_DMA1_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables DMA1 for I2S receive.

BitField.name: TX_DMA1_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables DMA1 for I2S transmit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RX_DEPTH_DMA1
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level that triggers a receive DMA request on DMA1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_DEPTH_DMA1
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level that triggers a transmit DMA request on DMA1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DMA2
Register.description: I2S DMA Configuration Register 2. Contains control information for DMA request 2.

BitField.name: RX_DMA2_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables DMA1 for I2S receive.

BitField.name: TX_DMA2_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables DMA1 for I2S transmit.

BitField.name: RX_DEPTH_DMA2
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level that triggers a receive DMA request on DMA2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_DEPTH_DMA2
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level that triggers a transmit DMA request on DMA2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IRQ
Register.description: I2S Interrupt Request Control Register. Contains bits that control how the I2S interrupt request is generated.

BitField.name: RX_IRQ_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables I2S receive interrupt.

BitField.name: TX_IRQ_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables I2S transmit interrupt.

BitField.name: RX_DEPTH_IRQ
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level on which to create an irq request.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_DEPTH_IRQ
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level on which to create an irq request.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TXRATE
Register.description: I2S Transmit MCLK divider. This register determines the I2S TX MCLK rate by specifying the value to divide PCLK by in order to produce MCLK.

BitField.name: Y_DIVIDER
BitField.description: I2S transmit MCLK rate denominator. This value is used to divide PCLK to produce the transmit MCLK. Eight bits of fractional divide supports a wide range of possibilities. A value of 0 stops the clock.

BitField.name: X_DIVIDER
BitField.description: I2S transmit MCLK rate numerator. This value is used to multiply PCLK by to produce the transmit MCLK. A value of 0 stops the clock. Eight bits of fractional divide supports a wide range of possibilities. Note: the resulting ratio X/Y is divided by 2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RXRATE
Register.description: I2S Receive MCLK divider. This register determines the I2S RX MCLK rate by specifying the value to divide PCLK by in order to produce MCLK.

BitField.name: Y_DIVIDER
BitField.description: I2S receive MCLK rate denominator. This value is used to divide PCLK to produce the receive MCLK. Eight bits of fractional divide supports a wide range of possibilities. A value of 0 stops the clock.

BitField.name: X_DIVIDER
BitField.description: I2S receive MCLK rate numerator. This value is used to multiply PCLK by to produce the receive MCLK. A value of 0 stops the clock. Eight bits of fractional divide supports a wide range of possibilities. Note: the resulting ratio X/Y is divided by 2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TXBITRATE
Register.description: I2S Transmit bit rate divider. This register determines the I2S transmit bit rate by specifying the value to divide TX_MCLK by in order to produce the transmit bit clock.

BitField.name: TX_BITRATE
BitField.description: I2S transmit bit rate. This value plus one is used to divide TX_MCLK to produce the transmit bit clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RXBITRATE
Register.description: I2S Receive bit rate divider. This register determines the I2S receive bit rate by specifying the value to divide RX_MCLK by in order to produce the receive bit clock.

BitField.name: RX_BITRATE
BitField.description: I2S receive bit rate. This value plus one is used to divide RX_MCLK to produce the receive bit clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TXCLKSEL
BitField.description: Clock source selection for the transmit bit clock divider.

Enum.name: SELECT_THE_TX_FRACTI
Enum.description: Select the TX fractional rate divider clock output as the source

Enum.name: SELECT_THE_RX_MCLK_S
Enum.description: Select the RX_MCLK signal as the TX_MCLK clock source

BitField.name: TX4PIN
BitField.description: Transmit 4-pin mode selection. When 1, enables 4-pin mode.

BitField.name: TXMCENA
BitField.description: Enable for the TX_MCLK output. When 0, output of TX_MCLK is not enabled. When 1, output of TX_MCLK is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RXCLKSEL
BitField.description: Clock source selection for the receive bit clock divider.

Enum.name: SELECT_THE_RX_FRACTI
Enum.description: Select the RX fractional rate divider clock output as the source

Enum.name: SELECT_THE_TX_MCLK_S
Enum.description: Select the TX_MCLK signal as the RX_MCLK clock source

BitField.name: RX4PIN
BitField.description: Receive 4-pin mode selection. When 1, enables 4-pin mode.

BitField.name: RXMCENA
BitField.description: Enable for the RX_MCLK output. When 0, output of RX_MCLK is not enabled. When 1, output of RX_MCLK is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RUN0
BitField.description: Stops/starts timer channel 0.

BitField.name: CENTER0
BitField.description: Edge/center aligned operation for channel 0.

BitField.name: POLA0
BitField.description: Selects polarity of the MCOA0 and MCOB0 pins.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_LOW
Enum.description: Passive state is LOW, active state is HIGH.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_HIG
Enum.description: Passive state is HIGH, active state is LOW.

BitField.name: DTE0
BitField.description: Controls the dead-time feature for channel 0.

BitField.name: DISUP0
BitField.description: Enable/disable updates of functional registers for channel 0 (see Section 24.8.2).

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers are updated from the write registers at the end of each PWM cycle.

Enum.name: NOUPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers remain the same as long as the timer is running.

BitField.name: RUN1
BitField.description: Stops/starts timer channel 1.

BitField.name: CENTER1
BitField.description: Edge/center aligned operation for channel 1.

BitField.name: POLA1
BitField.description: Selects polarity of the MCOA1 and MCOB1 pins.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_LOW
Enum.description: Passive state is LOW, active state is HIGH.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_HIG
Enum.description: Passive state is HIGH, active state is LOW.

BitField.name: DTE1
BitField.description: Controls the dead-time feature for channel 1.

BitField.name: DISUP1
BitField.description: Enable/disable updates of functional registers for channel 1 (see Section 24.8.2).

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers are updated from the write registers at the end of each PWM cycle.

Enum.name: NOUPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers remain the same as long as the timer is running.

BitField.name: RUN2
BitField.description: Stops/starts timer channel 2.

BitField.name: CENTER2
BitField.description: Edge/center aligned operation for channel 2.

BitField.name: POLA2
BitField.description: Selects polarity of the MCOA2 and MCOB2 pins.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_LOW
Enum.description: Passive state is LOW, active state is HIGH.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_HIG
Enum.description: Passive state is HIGH, active state is LOW.

BitField.name: DTE2
BitField.description: Controls the dead-time feature for channel 1.

BitField.name: DISUP2
BitField.description: Enable/disable updates of functional registers for channel 2 (see Section 24.8.2).

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers are updated from the write registers at the end of each PWM cycle.

Enum.name: NOUPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers remain the same as long as the timer is running.

BitField.name: INVBDC
BitField.description: Controls the polarity of the MCOB outputs for all 3 channels. This bit is typically set to 1 only in 3-phase DC mode.

Enum.name: OPPOSITE
Enum.description: The MCOB outputs have opposite polarity from the MCOA outputs (aside from dead time).

Enum.name: SAME
Enum.description: The MCOB outputs have the same basic polarity as the MCOA outputs. (see Section 24.8.6)

BitField.name: ACMODE
BitField.description: 3-phase AC mode select (see Section 24.8.7).

Enum.name: 3_PHASE_AC_MODE_OFF
Enum.description: 3-phase AC-mode off: Each PWM channel uses its own timer-counter and period register.

Enum.name: 3_PHASE_AC_MODE_ON_
Enum.description: 3-phase AC-mode on: All PWM channels use the timer-counter and period register of channel 0.

BitField.name: DCMODE
BitField.description: 3-phase DC mode select (see Section 24.8.6).

Enum.name: 3_PHASE_DC_MODE_OFF
Enum.description: 3-phase DC mode off: PWM channels are independent (unless bit ACMODE = 1)

Enum.name: 3_PHASE_DC_MODE_ON_
Enum.description: 3-phase DC mode on: The internal MCOA0 output is routed through the CP register (i.e. a mask) register to all six PWM outputs.

BitField.name: CAP0MCI0_RE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 0 capture event on a rising edge on MCI0.

BitField.name: CAP0MCI0_FE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 0 capture event on a falling edge on MCI0.

BitField.name: CAP0MCI1_RE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 0 capture event on a rising edge on MCI1.

BitField.name: CAP0MCI1_FE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 0 capture event on a falling edge on MCI1.

BitField.name: CAP0MCI2_RE

BitField.name: CAP0MCI2_FE

BitField.name: CAP1MCI0_RE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 1 capture event on a rising edge on MCI0.

BitField.name: CAP1MCI0_FE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 1 capture event on a falling edge on MCI0.

BitField.name: CAP1MCI1_RE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 1 capture event on a rising edge on MCI1.

BitField.name: CAP1MCI1_FE

BitField.name: CAP1MCI2_RE

BitField.name: CAP1MCI2_FE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 1 capture event on a falling edge on MCI2.

BitField.name: CAP2MCI0_RE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 2 capture event on a rising edge on MCI0.

BitField.name: CAP2MCI0_FE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 2 capture event on a falling edge on MCI0.

BitField.name: CAP2MCI1_RE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 2 capture event on a rising edge on MCI1.

BitField.name: CAP2MCI1_FE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 2 capture event on a falling edge on MCI1.

BitField.name: CAP2MCI2_RE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 2 capture event on a rising edge on MCI2.

BitField.name: CAP2MCI2_FE
BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 2 capture event on a falling edge on MCI2.

BitField.name: RT0
BitField.description: If this bit is 1, TC0 is reset by a channel 0 capture event.

BitField.name: RT1
BitField.description: If this bit is 1, TC1 is reset by a channel 1 capture event.

BitField.name: RT2
BitField.description: If this bit is 1, TC2 is reset by a channel 2 capture event.

BitField.name: CAP_CLR0
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the CAP0 register.

BitField.name: CAP_CLR1
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the CAP1 register.

BitField.name: CAP_CLR2
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the CAP2 register.

BitField.name: RESP
BitField.description: Reset position counter. When set = 1, resets the position counter to all zeros. Autoclears when the position counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RESPI
BitField.description: Reset position counter on index. When set = 1, resets the position counter to all zeros once only the first time an index pulse occurs. Autoclears when the position counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RESV
BitField.description: Reset velocity. When set = 1, resets the velocity counter to all zeros, reloads the velocity timer, and presets the velocity compare register. Autoclears when the velocity counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RESI
BitField.description: Reset index counter. When set = 1, resets the index counter to all zeros. Autoclears when the index counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DIRINV
BitField.description: Direction invert. When 1, complements the DIR bit.

BitField.name: SIGMODE
BitField.description: Signal Mode. When 0, PhA and PhB function as quadrature encoder inputs. When 1, PhA functions as the direction signal and PhB functions as the clock signal.

BitField.name: CAPMODE
BitField.description: Capture Mode. When 0, only PhA edges are counted (2X). When 1, BOTH PhA and PhB edges are counted (4X), increasing resolution but decreasing range.

BitField.name: INVINX
BitField.description: Invert Index. When 1, inverts the sense of the index input.

BitField.name: CRESPI
BitField.description: Continuously reset the position counter on index. When 1, resets the position counter to all zeros whenever an index pulse occurs after the next position increase (recalibration).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: INXGATE
BitField.description: Index gating configuration: When INXGATE[16] = 1, pass the index when PHA = 1 and PHB = 0, otherwise block index. When INXGATE[17] = 1, pass the index when PHA = 1 and PHB = 1, otherwise block index. When INXGATE[18] = 1, pass the index when PHA = 0 and PHB = 1, otherwise block index. When INXGATE[19] = 1, pass the index when PHA = 0 and PHB = 0, otherwise block index.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Direction bit. In combination with DIRINV bit indicates forward or reverse direction. See Table 597.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: POS
BitField.description: Current position value.

BitField.name: MAXPOS
BitField.description: Current maximum position value.

BitField.name: PCMP0
BitField.description: Position compare value 0.

BitField.name: PCMP1
BitField.description: Position compare value 1.

BitField.name: PCMP2
BitField.description: Position compare value 2.

BitField.name: ENCPOS
BitField.description: Current index counter value.

BitField.name: ICMP0
BitField.description: Index compare value 0.

BitField.name: VELLOAD
BitField.description: Current velocity timer load value.

BitField.name: VELVAL
BitField.description: Current velocity timer value.

BitField.name: VELPC
BitField.description: Current velocity pulse count.

BitField.name: VELCAP
BitField.description: Last velocity capture.

BitField.name: VELPC
BitField.description: Compare velocity pulse count.

BitField.name: FILTA
BitField.description: Digital filter sampling delay for PhA.

BitField.name: FILTB
BitField.description: Digital filter sampling delay for PhB.

BitField.name: FITLINX
BitField.description: Digital filter sampling delay for the index.

BitField.name: WINDOW
BitField.description: Index acceptance window width.

BitField.name: ICMP1
BitField.description: Index compare value 1.

BitField.name: ICMP2
BitField.description: Index compare value 2.

BitField.name: INX_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that an index pulse was detected.

BitField.name: TIM_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that a velocity timer overflow occurred

BitField.name: VELC_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that captured velocity is less than compare velocity.

BitField.name: DIR_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that a change of direction was detected.

BitField.name: ERR_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that an encoder phase error was detected.

BitField.name: ENCLK_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that and encoder clock pulse was detected.

BitField.name: POS0_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the position 0 compare value is equal to the current position.

BitField.name: POS1_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the position 1compare value is equal to the current position.

BitField.name: POS2_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the position 2 compare value is equal to the current position.

BitField.name: REV0_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the index compare 0 value is equal to the current index count.

BitField.name: POS0REV_INT
BitField.description: Combined position 0 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS0_Int bit is set and the REV0_Int is set.

BitField.name: POS1REV_INT
BitField.description: Combined position 1 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS1_Int bit is set and the REV1_Int is set.

BitField.name: POS2REV_INT
BitField.description: Combined position 2 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS2_Int bit is set and the REV2_Int is set.

BitField.name: REV1_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the index compare 1value is equal to the current index count.

BitField.name: REV2_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the index compare 2 value is equal to the current index count.

BitField.name: MAXPOS_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the current position count goes through the MAXPOS value to zero in the forward direction, or through zero to MAXPOS in the reverse direction.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: INX_INT
BitField.description: Writing a 1 sets the INX_Int bit in QEIINTSTAT.

BitField.name: TIM_INT
BitField.description: Writing a 1 sets the TIN_Int bit in QEIINTSTAT.

BitField.name: VELC_INT
BitField.description: Writing a 1 sets the VELC_Int bit in QEIINTSTAT.

BitField.name: DIR_INT
BitField.description: Writing a 1 sets the DIR_Int bit in QEIINTSTAT.

BitField.name: ERR_INT
BitField.description: Writing a 1 sets the ERR_Int bit in QEIINTSTAT.

BitField.name: ENCLK_INT
BitField.description: Writing a 1 sets the ENCLK_Int bit in QEIINTSTAT.

BitField.name: POS0_INT
BitField.description: Writing a 1 sets the POS0_Int bit in QEIINTSTAT.

BitField.name: POS1_INT
