Register.name: FLASHCFG
Register.description: Flash Accelerator Configuration Register. Controls flash access timing.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not change these bits from the reset value.

BitField.name: FLASHTIM
BitField.description: Flash access time. The value of this field plus 1 gives the number of CPU clocks used for a flash access. Warning: improper setting of this value may result in incorrect operation of the device. All other values are reserved.

Enum.name: FLASH_ACCESSES_USE_1
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 1 CPU clock. Use for up to 20 MHz CPU clock with power boost off.

Enum.name: FLASH_ACCESSES_USE_2
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 2 CPU clocks. Use for up to 40 MHz CPU clock with power boost off.

Enum.name: FLASH_ACCESSES_USE_3
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 3 CPU clocks. Use for up to 60 MHz CPU clock with power boost off.

Enum.name: FLASH_ACCESSES_USE_4
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 4 CPU clocks. Use for up to 80 MHz CPU clock with power boost off. Use this setting for operation from 100 to 120 MHz operation with power boost on.

Enum.name: FLASH_ACCESSES_USE_5
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 5 CPU clocks. Use for up to 100 MHz CPU clock with power boost off.

Enum.name: FLASH_ACCESSES_USE_6
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 6 CPU clocks. Safe setting for any allowed conditions.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PLLE
BitField.description: PLL Enable. When one, and after a valid PLL feed, this bit will activate the related PLL and allow it to lock to the requested frequency. See PLLSTAT register, Table 12.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PLLE
BitField.description: PLL Enable. When one, and after a valid PLL feed, this bit will activate the related PLL and allow it to lock to the requested frequency. See PLLSTAT register, Table 12.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: MSEL
BitField.description: PLL Multiplier value. Supplies the value "M" in the PLL frequency calculations. Note: For details on selecting the right value for MSEL see Section 3.10.4.

BitField.name: PSEL
BitField.description: PLL Divider value. Supplies the value "P" in the PLL frequency calculations. Note: For details on selecting the right value for PSEL see Section 3.10.4.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: MSEL
BitField.description: PLL Multiplier value. Supplies the value "M" in the PLL frequency calculations. Note: For details on selecting the right value for MSEL see Section 3.10.4.

BitField.name: PSEL
BitField.description: PLL Divider value. Supplies the value "P" in the PLL frequency calculations. Note: For details on selecting the right value for PSEL see Section 3.10.4.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: MSEL
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL Multiplier value. This is the value currently used by the related PLL.

BitField.name: PSEL
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL Divider value. This is the value currently used by the related PLL.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLLE_STAT
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL Enable bit. When one, the related PLL is currently activated. When zero, the related PLL is turned off. This bit is automatically cleared when Power-down mode is activated.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLOCK
BitField.description: Reflects the PLL Lock status. When zero, the related PLL is not locked. When one, the related PLL is locked onto the requested frequency.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MSEL
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL Multiplier value. This is the value currently used by the related PLL.

BitField.name: PSEL
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL Divider value. This is the value currently used by the related PLL.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLLE_STAT
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL Enable bit. When one, the related PLL is currently activated. When zero, the related PLL is turned off. This bit is automatically cleared when Power-down mode is activated.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLOCK
BitField.description: Reflects the PLL Lock status. When zero, the related PLL is not locked. When one, the related PLL is locked onto the requested frequency.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLLFEED
BitField.description: The PLL feed sequence must be written to this register in order for the related PLL's configuration and control register changes to take effect.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PLLFEED
BitField.description: The PLL feed sequence must be written to this register in order for the related PLL's configuration and control register changes to take effect.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PM0
BitField.description: Power mode control bit 0. This bit controls entry to the Power-down mode. See Section 3.3.6.1 below for details.

BitField.name: PM1
BitField.description: Power mode control bit 1. This bit controls entry to the Deep Power-down mode. See Section 3.3.6.1 below for details.

BitField.name: BODRPM
BitField.description: Brown-Out Reduced Power Mode. When BODRPM is 1, the Brown-Out Detect circuitry will be turned off when chip Power-down mode or Deep Sleep mode is entered, resulting in a further reduction in power usage. However, the possibility of using Brown-Out Detect as a wake-up source from the reduced power mode will be lost. When 0, the Brown-Out Detect function remains active during Power-down and Deep Sleep modes. See the System Control Block chapter for details of Brown-Out detection.

BitField.name: BOGD
BitField.description: Brown-Out Global Disable. When BOGD is 1, the Brown-Out Detect circuitry is fully disabled at all times, and does not consume power. When 0, the Brown-Out Detect circuitry is enabled. See the System Control Block chapter for details of Brown-Out detection.

BitField.name: BORD
BitField.description: Brown-Out Reset Disable. When BORD is 1, the BOD will not reset the device when the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage dips goes below the BOD reset trip level. The Brown-Out interrupt is not affected. When BORD is 0, the BOD reset is enabled. See the Section 3.6 for details of Brown-Out detection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: SMFLAG
BitField.description: Sleep Mode entry flag. Set when the Sleep mode is successfully entered. Cleared by software writing a one to this bit.

BitField.name: DSFLAG
BitField.description: Deep Sleep entry flag. Set when the Deep Sleep mode is successfully entered. Cleared by software writing a one to this bit.

BitField.name: PDFLAG
BitField.description: Power-down entry flag. Set when the Power-down mode is successfully entered. Cleared by software writing a one to this bit.

BitField.name: DPDFLAG
BitField.description: Deep Power-down entry flag. Set when the Deep Power-down mode is successfully entered. Cleared by software writing a one to this bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PCLCD
BitField.description: LCD controller power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCTIM0
BitField.description: Timer/Counter 0 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCTIM1
BitField.description: Timer/Counter 1 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART0
BitField.description: UART0 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART1
BitField.description: UART1 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCPWM0
BitField.description: PWM0 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCPWM1
BitField.description: PWM1 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCI2C0
BitField.description: I2C0 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART4
BitField.description: UART4 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCRTC
BitField.description: RTC and Event Monitor/Recorder power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCSSP1
BitField.description: SSP 1 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCEMC
BitField.description: External Memory Controller power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCADC
BitField.description: A/D converter (ADC) power/clock control bit. Note: Clear the PDN bit in the AD0CR before clearing this bit, and set this bit before attempting to set PDN.

BitField.name: PCCAN1
BitField.description: CAN Controller 1 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCCAN2
BitField.description: CAN Controller 2 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCGPIO
BitField.description: Power/clock control bit for IOCON, GPIO, and GPIO interrupts.

BitField.name: PCSPIFI
BitField.description: SPI Flash Interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCMCPWM
BitField.description: Motor Control PWM power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCQEI
BitField.description: Quadrature Encoder Interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCI2C1
BitField.description: I2C1 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCSSP2
BitField.description: SSP2 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCSSP0
BitField.description: SSP0 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCTIM2
BitField.description: Timer 2 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCTIM3
BitField.description: Timer 3 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART2
BitField.description: UART 2 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART3
BitField.description: UART 3 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCI2C2
BitField.description: I2C interface 2 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCI2S
BitField.description: I2S interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCSDC
BitField.description: SD Card interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCGPDMA
BitField.description: GPDMA function power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCENET
BitField.description: Ethernet block power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUSB
BitField.description: USB interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCCMP
BitField.description: comparator 0/1 power/clock control bit.

Register.name: EMCCLKSEL
Register.description: External Memory Controller Clock Selection register

BitField.name: EMCDIV
BitField.description: Selects the EMC clock rate relative to the CPU clock.

Enum.name: THE_EMC_USES_THE_SAM
Enum.description: The EMC uses the same clock as the CPU.

Enum.name: THE_EMC_USES_A_CLOCK
Enum.description: The EMC uses a clock at half the rate of the CPU.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CCLKDIV
BitField.description: Selects the divide value for creating the CPU clock (CCLK) from the selected clock source. 0 = The divider is turned off., no clock will be provided to the CPU. This setting should typically not be used, the CPU will be halted and a reset will be required to restore operation. 1 = The input clock is divided by 1 to produce the CPU clock. 2 = The input clock is divided by 2 to produce the CPU clock. 3 = The input clock is divided by 3 to produce the CPU clock. ... 31 = The input clock is divided by 31 to produce the CPU clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CCLKSEL
BitField.description: Selects the input clock for the CPU clock divider.

Enum.name: SYSCLK_IS_USED_AS_TH
Enum.description: Sysclk is used as the input to the CPU clock divider.

Enum.name: THE_OUTPUT_OF_THE_MA
Enum.description: The output of the Main PLL is used as the input to the CPU clock divider.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: USBDIV
BitField.description: Selects the divide value for creating the USB clock from the selected PLL output. Only the values shown below can produce even number multiples of 48 MHz from the PLL. Warning: Improper setting of this value will result in incorrect operation of the USB interface. Only the main oscillator in conjunction with either PLL0 or PLL1 can provide a clock that meets USB accuracy and jitter specifications. Other values cannot produce the 48 MHz clock required for USB operation.

Enum.name: THE_DIVIDER_IS_TURNE
Enum.description: The divider is turned off, no clock will be provided to the USB subsystem.

Enum.name: PLL0_OUTPUT_IS_DIVID
Enum.description: PLL0 output is divided by 4. PLL0 output must be 192 MHz.

Enum.name: PLL0_OUTPUT_IS_DIVID
Enum.description: PLL0 output is divided by 6. PLL0 output must be 288 MHz.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: USBSEL
BitField.description: Selects the input clock for the USB clock divider.

Enum.name: SYSCLK
Enum.description: Sysclk is used as the input to the USB clock divider. When this clock is selected, the USB can be accessed by software but cannot perform USB functions.

Enum.name: MAINPLLOUT
Enum.description: The output of the Main PLL is used as the input to the USB clock divider.

Enum.name: ALTPLLOOUT
Enum.description: The output of the Alt PLL is used as the input to the USB clock divider.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CLKSRC
BitField.description: Selects the clock source for sysclk and PLL0 as follows:

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_INTERNAL
Enum.description: Selects the Internal RC oscillator as the sysclk and PLL0 clock source (default).

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_MAIN_OSC
Enum.description: Selects the main oscillator as the sysclk and PLL0 clock source.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CANSLEEPCLR
Register.description: Allows clearing the current CAN channel sleep state as well as reading that state.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CAN1SLEEP
BitField.description: Sleep status and control for CAN channel 1. Read: when 1, indicates that CAN channel 1 is in the sleep mode. Write: writing a 1 causes clocks to be restored to CAN channel 1.

BitField.name: CAN2SLEEP
BitField.description: Sleep status and control for CAN channel 2. Read: when 1, indicates that CAN channel 2 is in the sleep mode. Write: writing a 1 causes clocks to be restored to CAN channel 2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CANWAKEFLAGS
Register.description: Allows reading the wake-up state of the CAN channels.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CAN1WAKE
BitField.description: Wake-up status for CAN channel 1. Read: when 1, indicates that a falling edge has occurred on the receive data line of CAN channel 1. Write: writing a 1 clears this bit.

BitField.name: CAN2WAKE
BitField.description: Wake-up status for CAN channel 2. Read: when 1, indicates that a falling edge has occurred on the receive data line of CAN channel 2. Write: writing a 1 clears this bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EINT0
BitField.description: In level-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT0 function is selected for its pin, and the pin is in its active state. In edge-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT0 function is selected for its pin, and the selected edge occurs on the pin. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it, except in level sensitive mode when the pin is in its active state.[1]

BitField.name: EINT1
BitField.description: In level-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT1 function is selected for its pin, and the pin is in its active state. In edge-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT1 function is selected for its pin, and the selected edge occurs on the pin. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it, except in level sensitive mode when the pin is in its active state.[1]

BitField.name: EINT2
BitField.description: In level-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT2 function is selected for its pin, and the pin is in its active state. In edge-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT2 function is selected for its pin, and the selected edge occurs on the pin. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it, except in level sensitive mode when the pin is in its active state.[1]

BitField.name: EINT3
BitField.description: In level-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT3 function is selected for its pin, and the pin is in its active state. In edge-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT3 function is selected for its pin, and the selected edge occurs on the pin. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it, except in level sensitive mode when the pin is in its active state.[1]

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EXTMODE0
BitField.description: Level or edge sensitivity select for EINT0.

BitField.name: EXTMODE1
BitField.description: Level or edge sensitivity select for EINT1.

BitField.name: EXTMODE2
BitField.description: Level or edge sensitivity select for EINT2.

BitField.name: EXTMODE3
BitField.description: Level or edge sensitivity select for EINT3.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EXTPOLAR0
BitField.description: External interrupt polarity for EINT0.

Enum.name: LOW_ACTIVE_OR_FALLIN
Enum.description: Low-active or falling-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE0).

Enum.name: HIGH_ACTIVE_OR_RISIN
Enum.description: High-active or rising-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE0).

BitField.name: EXTPOLAR1
BitField.description: External interrupt polarity for EINT1.

Enum.name: LOW_ACTIVE_OR_FALLIN
Enum.description: Low-active or falling-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE1).

Enum.name: HIGH_ACTIVE_OR_RISIN
Enum.description: High-active or rising-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE1).

BitField.name: EXTPOLAR2
BitField.description: External interrupt polarity for EINT2.

Enum.name: LOW_ACTIVE_OR_FALLIN
Enum.description: Low-active or falling-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE2).

Enum.name: HIGH_ACTIVE_OR_RISIN
Enum.description: High-active or rising-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE2).

BitField.name: EXTPOLAR3
BitField.description: External interrupt polarity for EINT3.

Enum.name: LOW_ACTIVE_OR_FALLIN
Enum.description: Low-active or falling-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE3).

Enum.name: HIGH_ACTIVE_OR_RISIN
Enum.description: High-active or rising-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE3).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: POR
BitField.description: Assertion of the POR signal sets this bit, and clears all of the other bits in this register. But if another Reset signal (e.g., External Reset) remains asserted after the POR signal is negated, then its bit is set. This bit is not affected by any of the other sources of Reset.

BitField.name: EXTR
BitField.description: Assertion of the external RESET signal sets this bit. This bit is cleared only by software or POR.

BitField.name: WDTR
BitField.description: This bit is set when the Watchdog Timer times out and the WDTRESET bit in the Watchdog Mode Register is 1. This bit is cleared only by software or POR.

BitField.name: BODR
BitField.description: This bit is set when the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage reaches a level below the BOD reset trip level (typically 1.85 V under nominal room temperature conditions). If the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage dips from the normal operating range to below the BOD reset trip level and recovers, the BODR bit will be set to 1. If the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage dips from the normal operating range to below the BOD reset trip level and continues to decline to the level at which POR is asserted (nominally 1 V), the BODR bit is cleared. If the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage rises continuously from below 1 V to a level above the BOD reset trip level, the BODR will be set to 1. This bit is cleared only by software or POR. Note: Only in the case where a reset occurs and the POR = 0, the BODR bit indicates if the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage was below the BOD reset trip level or not.

BitField.name: SYSRESET
BitField.description: This bit is set if the processor has been reset due to a system reset request. Setting the SYSRESETREQ bit in the Cortex-M4 AIRCR register causes a chip reset. This bit is cleared only by software or POR.

BitField.name: LOCKUP
BitField.description: This bit is set if the processor has been reset due to a "lockup". The lockup state causes a chip reset. This bit is cleared only by software or POR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PRI_ICODE
BitField.description: I-Code bus priority. Should be lower than PRI_DCODE for proper operation.

BitField.name: PRI_DCODE
BitField.description: D-Code bus priority.

BitField.name: PRI_SYS
BitField.description: System bus priority.

BitField.name: PRI_GPDMA
BitField.description: General Purpose DMA controller priority.

BitField.name: PRI_ETH
BitField.description: Ethernet DMA priority.

BitField.name: PRI_LCD
BitField.description: LCD DMA priority.

BitField.name: PRI_USB
BitField.description: USB DMA priority.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ROM_LAT
BitField.description: ROM latency select. Should always be 0.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EMCSC
BitField.description: EMC Shift Control. Controls how addresses are output on the EMC address pins for static memories. Also see Section 9.9 in the EMC chapter.

Enum.name: STATIC_MEMORY_ADDRES
Enum.description: Static memory addresses are shifted to match the data bus width. For example, when accessing a 32-bit wide data bus, the address is shifted right 2 places such that bit 2 is the LSB. In this mode, address bit 0 for the this device is connected to address bit 0 of the memory device, thus simplifying memory connections. This also makes a larger memory address range possible, because additional upper address bits can appear on the higher address pins due to the shift.

Enum.name: STATIC_MEMORY_ADDRES
Enum.description: Static memory addresses are always output as byte addresses regardless of the data bus width. For example, when word data is accessed on a 32-bit bus, address bits 1 and 0 will always be 0. In this mode, one or both lower address bits may not be connected to memories that are part of a bus that is wider than 8 bits. This mode matches the operation of LPC23xx and LPC24xx devices.

BitField.name: EMCRD
BitField.description: EMC Reset Disable[1]. External Memory Controller Reset Disable. Also see Section 9.8 in the EMC chapter.

Enum.name: BOTH_EMC_RESETS_ARE_
Enum.description: Both EMC resets are asserted when any type of chip reset event occurs. In this mode, all registers and functions of the EMC are initialized upon any reset condition.

Enum.name: MANY_PORTIONS_OF_THE
Enum.description: Many portions of the EMC are only reset by a power-on or brown-out event, in order to allow the EMC to retain its state through a warm reset (external reset or watchdog reset). If the EMC is configured correctly, auto-refresh can be maintained through a warm reset.

BitField.name: EMCBC
BitField.description: External Memory Controller burst control. Also see Section 9.10 in the EMC chapter.

Enum.name: BURST_DISABLED_THIS
Enum.description: Burst disabled. This mode can be used to prevent multiple sequential accesses to memory mapped I/O devices connected to EMC static memory chip selects. These unrequested accesses can cause issues with some I/O devices.

BitField.name: MCIPWRAL
BitField.description: MCIPWR Active Level[1]. Selects the active level of the SD card interface signal SD_PWR.

Enum.name: SD_PWR_IS_ACTIVE_LOW
Enum.description: SD_PWR is active low (inverted output of the SD Card interface block).

Enum.name: SD_PWR_IS_ACTIVE_HIG
Enum.description: SD_PWR is active high (follows the output of the SD Card interface block).

BitField.name: OSCRS
BitField.description: Main oscillator range select.

Enum.name: THE_FREQUENCY_RANGE_
Enum.description: The frequency range of the main oscillator is 1 MHz to 20 MHz.

Enum.name: THE_FREQUENCY_RANGE_
Enum.description: The frequency range of the main oscillator is 15 MHz to 25 MHz.

BitField.name: OSCEN
BitField.description: Main oscillator enable.

Enum.name: THE_MAIN_OSCILLATOR_
Enum.description: The main oscillator is enabled, and will start up if the correct external circuitry is connected to the XTAL1 and XTAL2 pins.

BitField.name: OSCSTAT
BitField.description: Main oscillator status.

Enum.name: THE_MAIN_OSCILLATOR_
Enum.description: The main oscillator is not ready to be used as a clock source.

Enum.name: THE_MAIN_OSCILLATOR_
Enum.description: The main oscillator is ready to be used as a clock source. The main oscillator must be enabled via the OSCEN bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: PCLKDIV
BitField.description: Selects the divide value for the clock used for all APB peripherals. 0 = The divider is turned off., no clock will be provided to APB peripherals. 1 = The input clock is divided by 1 to produce the APB peripheral clock. 2 = The input clock is divided by 2 to produce the APB peripheral clock. 3 = The input clock is divided by 3 to produce the APB peripheral clock. ... 31 = The input clock is divided by 31 to produce the APB peripheral clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: Boost
BitField.description: Boost control bits. 00 : Boost is off, operation must be below 100 MHz. 11 : Boost is on, operation up to 120 MHz is supported. Other values are not allowed.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: SPIFIDIV
BitField.description: Selects the divide value for creating the SPIFI clock from the selected clock source. 0 = The divider is turned off., no clock will be provided to the SPIFI. 1 = The input clock is divided by 1 to produce the SPIFI clock. 2 = The input clock is divided by 2 to produce the SPIFI clock. 3 = The input clock is divided by 3 to produce the SPIFI clock. ... 31 = The input clock is divided by 31 to produce the SPIFI clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: SPIFISEL
BitField.description: Selects the input clock for the USB clock divider.

Enum.name: SYSCLK
Enum.description: Sysclk is used as the input to the SPIFI clock divider.

Enum.name: MAINPLLOUT
Enum.description: The output of the Main PLL is used as the input to the SPIFI clock divider.

Enum.name: ALTPLLOUT
Enum.description: The output of the Alt PLL is used as the input to the SPIFI clock divider.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CLKDIV
BitField.description: LCD panel clock prescaler selection. The value in the this register plus 1 is used to divide the selected input clock (see the CLKSEL bit in the LCD_POL register), to produce the panel clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: USB_INT_REQ_LP
BitField.description: Low priority interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_INT_REQ_HP
BitField.description: High priority interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_INT_REQ_DMA
BitField.description: DMA interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_HOST_INT
BitField.description: USB host interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_ATX_INT
BitField.description: External ATX interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_OTG_INT
BitField.description: OTG interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_I2C_INT
BitField.description: I2C module interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: USB_NEED_CLK
BitField.description: USB need clock indicator. This bit is read-only. This bit is set to 1 when USB activity or a change of state on the USB data pins is detected, and it indicates that a PLL supplied clock of 48 MHz is needed. Once USB_NEED_CLK becomes one, it resets to zero 5 ms after the last packet has been received/sent, or 2 ms after the Suspend Change (SUS_CH) interrupt has occurred. A change of this bit from 0 to 1 can wake up the microcontroller if activity on the USB bus is selected to wake up the part from the Power-down mode (see Section 3.12.8 "Wake-up from Reduced Power Modes" for details). Also see Section 3.10.3 "PLLs and Power-down mode" and Section 3.3.7 "Power Control for Peripherals registers" for considerations about the PLL and invoking the Power-down mode. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EN_USB_INTS
BitField.description: Enable all USB interrupts. When this bit is cleared, the NVIC does not see the ORed output of the USB interrupt lines.

Register.name: DMACREQSEL
Register.description: Selects between alternative requests on DMA channels 0 through 7 and 10 through 15

BitField.name: DMASEL00
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 0: 0 - (unused) 1 - Timer 0 match 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL01
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 1: 0 - SD card interface is selected. 1 - Timer 0 match 1 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL02
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 2: 0 - SSP0 transmit is selected. 1 - Timer 1 match 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL03
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 3: 0 - SSP0 receive is selected. 1 - Timer 1 match 1 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL04
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 4: 0 - SSP1 transmit is selected. 1 - Timer 2 match 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL05
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 5: 0 - SSP1 receive is selected. 1 - Timer 2 match 1 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL06
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 6: 0 - SSP2 transmit is selected. 1 - I2S channel 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL07
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 7: 0 - SSP2 receive is selected. 1 - I2S channel 1 is selected.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DMASEL10
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 10: 0 - UART0 transmit is selected. 1 - UART3 transmit is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL11
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 11: 0 - UART0 receive is selected. 1 - UART3 receive is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL12
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 12: 0 - UART1 transmit is selected. 1 - UART4 transmit is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL13
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 13: 0 - UART1 receive is selected. 1 - UART4 receive is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL14
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 14: 0 - UART2 transmit is selected. 1 - Timer 3 match 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL15
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 15: 0 - UART2 receive is selected. 1 - Timer 3 match 1 is selected.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CLKOUTSEL
BitField.description: Selects the clock source for the CLKOUT function. 0x0 = Selects the CPU clock as the CLKOUT source. 0x1 = Selects the main oscillator as the CLKOUT source. 0x2 = Selects the Internal RC oscillator as the CLKOUT source. 0x3 = Selects the USB clock as the CLKOUT source. 0x4 = Selects the RTC oscillator as the CLKOUT source. 0x5 = Selects the SPIFI clock as the CLKOUT source. 0x6 = Selects the Watchdog oscillator as the CLKOUT source. Other settings are reserved. Do not use.

BitField.name: CLKOUTDIV
BitField.description: Integer value to divide the output clock by, minus one. 0x0 = Clock is divided by 1. 0x1 = Clock is divided by 2. 0x2 = Clock is divided by 3. ... 0xF = Clock is divided by 16.

BitField.name: CLKOUT_EN
BitField.description: CLKOUT enable control, allows switching the CLKOUT source without glitches. Clear to stop CLKOUT on the next falling edge. Set to enable CLKOUT.

BitField.name: CLKOUT_ACT
BitField.description: CLKOUT activity indication. Reads as 1 when CLKOUT is enabled. Read as 0 when CLKOUT has been disabled via the CLKOUT_EN bit and the clock has completed being stopped.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RSTLCD
BitField.description: LCD controller reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTTIM0
BitField.description: Timer/Counter 0 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTTIM1
BitField.description: Timer/Counter 1 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTUART0
BitField.description: UART0 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTUART1
BitField.description: UART1 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTPWM0
BitField.description: PWM0 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTPWM1
BitField.description: PWM1 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTI2C0
BitField.description: The I2C0 interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTUART4
BitField.description: UART4 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTRTC
BitField.description: RTC and Event Monitor/Recorder reset control bit. RTC reset is limited, see Table 626 "Register overview: Real-Time Clock (base address 0x4002 4000)" for details.

BitField.name: RSTSSP1
BitField.description: The SSP 1 interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTEMC
BitField.description: External Memory Controller reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTADC
BitField.description: A/D converter (ADC) reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTCAN1
BitField.description: CAN Controller 1 reset control bit. Note: The CAN acceptance filter may be reset by a separate bit in the RSTCON1 register.

BitField.name: RSTCAN2
BitField.description: CAN Controller 2 reset control bit. Note: The CAN acceptance filter may be reset by a separate bit in the RSTCON1 register.

BitField.name: RSTGPIO
BitField.description: Reset control bit for GPIO, and GPIO interrupts. Note: IOCON may be reset by a separate bit in the RSTCON1 register.

BitField.name: RSTSPIFI
BitField.description: SPI Flash Interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTMCPWM
BitField.description: Motor Control PWM reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTQEI
BitField.description: Quadrature Encoder Interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTI2C1
BitField.description: The I2C1 interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTSSP2
BitField.description: The SSP2 interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTSSP0
BitField.description: The SSP0 interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTTIM2
BitField.description: Timer 2 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTTIM3
BitField.description: Timer 3 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTUART2
BitField.description: UART 2 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTUART3
BitField.description: UART 3 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTI2C2
BitField.description: I2C interface 2 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTI2S
BitField.description: I2S interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTSDC
BitField.description: SD Card interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTGPDMA
BitField.description: GPDMA function reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTENET
BitField.description: Ethernet block reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTUSB
BitField.description: USB interface reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTIOCON
BitField.description: Reset control bit for the IOCON registers.

BitField.name: RSTDAC
BitField.description: D/A converter (DAC) reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTCANACC
BitField.description: CAN acceptance filter reset control bit.

BitField.name: RSTCMP
BitField.description: Comparator 0/1 reset control bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: EMCDLYCTL
Register.description: Values for the 4 programmable delays associated with SDRAM operation.

BitField.name: CMDDLY
BitField.description: Programmable delay value for EMC outputs in command delayed mode. See Section 9.12.6. The delay amount is roughly (CMDDLY+1) * 250 picoseconds. This field applies only when the command delayed read strategy is selected in the EMCDynamicReadConfig register. In this mode, all control outputs from the EMC are delayed, but the output clock is not. Delaying the control outputs changes dynamic characteristics defined in the device data sheet.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: FBCLKDLY
BitField.description: Programmable delay value for the feedback clock that controls input data sampling. See Section 9.5.3. The delay amount is roughly (FBCLKDLY+1) * 250 picoseconds.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CLKOUT0DLY
BitField.description: Programmable delay value for the CLKOUT0 output. This would typically be used in clock delayed mode. See Section 9.12.6 The delay amount is roughly (CLKOUT0DLY+1) * 250 picoseconds. Delaying the clock output changes dynamic characteristics defined in the device data sheet.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CLKOUT1DLY
BitField.description: Programmable delay value for the CLKOUT1 output. This would typically be used in clock delayed mode. See Section 9.12.6 The delay amount is roughly (CLKOUT1DLY+1) * 250 picoseconds.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: EMCCAL
Register.description: Controls the calibration counter for programmable delays and returns the result value.

BitField.name: CALVALUE
BitField.description: Returns the count of the approximately 50 MHz ring oscillator that occur during 32 clocks of the IRC oscillator. This represents the composite effect of processing variation, internal regulator supply voltage, and ambient temperature.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start control bit for the EMC calibration counter. Writing a 1 to this bit begins the measurement process. This bit is cleared automatically when the measurement is complete.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: Measurement completion flag. this bit is set when a calibration measurement is completed. This bit is cleared automatically when the START bit is set.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: COUNTFLAG
BitField.description: Counter Flag

BitField.name: CLKSOURCE
BitField.description: Timer Clock Source

BitField.name: TICKINT
BitField.description: Tick Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable SysTick Timer

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: DISOOFP
BitField.description: Disables floating pointinstructions completing outof order with respect to integer instructions

BitField.name: DISFPCA
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables IT folding

BitField.name: DISFOLD
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: IMPLEMENTER
BitField.description: Implementer Code

BitField.name: VARIANT
BitField.description: Variant Number

BitField.name: PARTNO
BitField.description: Part Number

BitField.name: REVISION
BitField.description: Revision Number

BitField.description: NMI set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSVSET
BitField.description: PendSV set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSVCLR
BitField.description: PendSV clear-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSTSET
BitField.description: SysTick exception set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSTCLR
BitField.description: SysTick exception clear-pending bit

BitField.name: ISRPENDING
BitField.description: Interrupt pending flag

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

BitField.name: VECTACTIVE
BitField.description: Contains the active exception number

BitField.name: TBLOFF
BitField.description: Vector table base offset field

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: VECTKEY
BitField.description: Register key

BitField.name: ENDIANESS
BitField.description: Data endianness bit

BitField.name: PRIGROUP
BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field

BitField.name: SYSRESETREQ
BitField.description: System reset request bit

BitField.name: SEVONPEND
BitField.description: Send event on pending bit

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: UNALIGN_TRP
BitField.description: Enables unaligned access traps

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

BitField.name: PRI_6
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 6 (UsageFault)

BitField.name: PRI_5
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 5 (BusFault)

BitField.name: PRI_4
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 4 (MemManage)

BitField.name: PRI_11
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 11 (SVCall)

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15 (SysTick)

BitField.name: PRI_14
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 14 (PendSV)

Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.description: UsageFault Exception Active Bit

BitField.description: BusFault Exception Active Bit

BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: IACCVIOL
BitField.description: Instruction access violation flag

BitField.name: BFARVALID
BitField.description: BusFault Address Register(BFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: IMPRECISERR
BitField.description: Imprecise data bus error

BitField.name: PRECISERR
BitField.description: Precise data bus error

BitField.name: IBUSERR
BitField.description: Instruction bus error

BitField.name: DIVBYZERO
BitField.description: Divide by zero UsageFault

BitField.name: UNALIGNED
BitField.description: Unaligned access UsageFault

BitField.name: NOCP
BitField.description: No coprocessor UsageFault

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: INVSTATE
BitField.description: Invalid state UsageFault

BitField.name: UNDEFINSTR
BitField.description: Undefined instruction UsageFault

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: IREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU instruction regions

BitField.name: DREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU data regions

BitField.name: SEPARATE
BitField.description: Support for unified or separate instruction and date memory maps

BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA
BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to the default memory map

BitField.name: HFNMIENA
BitField.description: Enable the operation of MPU during hard fault, NMI, and FAULTMASK handlers

BitField.name: REGION
